characters: DOCTOR, I DID AS YOU ASKED. BUT
THINK I MADE STUPID MISTAKE. HOPE
...MEANS THE MOST TO ME. LOVE YOU
BACK DOWN IN THE DARK CHAMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHADOWS DANCE.  A bare bulb swings from the ceiling revea clothes on a chair, puddles of water on the floor... SLEEPING EYES in and out of darkness.  The eyes open. Confusion. WIDEN ANGLE ON JONATHAN WHITE  -  a man in his early thir dark featured. He sits up.  Water splashes.  He's in a tub of long cold His neck aches like he's been sleeping forever. He looks down into the murky water around him.  A feint movement beneath the surface, something swimming  -  A SM DARK SHAPE.  Startled, he leaps from the bath. ANGLE  -  THE SWINGING LIGHT BULB.  The man's hand reache stops the light-bulb mid swing. He steps to a circular window.  The glass is cracked, cov in grime.  He wipes it, this only smears the dirt. It's dark out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON WHITE  -  from outside the window, through blurr glass. A RAPID FLYING P.O.V. PULLS BACK in silence.  The window SPECK on the side of a vast grey tower.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: White shivers, cold.  He stares down at the puddle he dri the floor.  He looks at his feet and legs, covered with numerous SMALL BITES.  He dries the bloody wounds with a He picks up the clothes lying on the chair, puts them on. Loose trousers with braces, a plain shirt, leathers shoes HOLES in both soles.  In his trouser pocket he finds a ke a room number on a plastic tag. He hears splashing in the bath-tub.  He steps over, looks the murky water.  Suddenly a SMALL SILVER FISH leaps from water, lands at his feet, panting heavily and flapping ab He leans down, picks the fish up, throws it back into the water. Like a blind man, he feels the walls, comes to a door in shadows.  He hears something on the other side, hesitates inches from the doorknob.  He leans down.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON HIS EYE
dialogues.text: Blinking through the key-hole. P.O.V. OF AN EMPTY ROOM  -  A glimpse of motion  -  the d across the room (leading to a corridor?) is shutting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE pushes the door open, steps into the adjoining room No sign of life.  Cheap decorations.  He walks around cautiously.  Turns lights on.  Then reconsiders.  Turns t again.  Disturbed, he studies his features in a wall mirr ANGLE ON OPEN BATHROOM DOOR  -  the fish has jumped from again and is flapping on the floor. White steps back into the bathroom.  He picks up the fish doesn't know what to do with it, so he puts it in his poc

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE OTHER ROOM
dialogues.text: He searches through things.  A grey overcoat in the close goes through the pockets, finds a WALLET.  No I.D., just laundry bill, some money and a postcard from a sea-side t ANGLE ON A REVOLVER on the bed-side table.  He picks it u grip tightens on the handle, his finger applies pressure trigger and...

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: The gun goes off.  A BULLET RICOCHETS wildly around the r bounces off the metal bed-head, smashes a vase, embeds it in the wall. Startled, he holds the gun away from him like it might go again.  He examines it carefully now.  Opens the chamber. TIGHT ON THE GUN  -  Five bullets left. He turns the chamber carefully, shuts it, puts the gun in inside pocket of the coat. He moves to the bed.  A RIPPED PHOTOGRAPH on the rug.  A fragment of a woman's face, her left eye.  He lifts the fragment up.  There's handwriting on the back, part of a

dialogues.speaker: FOREVER.
dialogues.text: The rest is missing. He sits on the edge of the bed.  As he does this, he noti something else on the floor. HIS P.O.V.  -  follows a dark stain on the floorboards, t woman's bare foot behind the bed.  He stands abruptly, fu across the bed to stare into a dark corner of the room. In the shadows he can make out a woman's naked BODY lying pool of blood.  Her eyes stare lifeless. White stumbles back in horror, throws his hands across hi mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White stumbles from the room, leans against a wall for su Lights flicker. At the end of the corridor, elevator doors open.  Light a musak flood out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White staggers from the elevator, moves past a deserted f desk.  A VOICE from the back room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you! You gotta message. White stops, looks uncertainly towards a bead curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Message in d'box!  You deaf? White sees several nooks for messages and keys in front o Reaching across the desk, he glances through the bead cur into the manager's office.  TELEVISION SOUNDS O.S. HIS P.O.V. Hard to see  -  the man sits in the chair, lit by the glo the T.V. set.  White grabs the note, looks at it.  A PHON NUMBER, also his room number, and what appears to be his JONATHAN WHITE.  That's all.  White thrusts the message i pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got my money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  I...  How long have I been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, too damn long if you ask me! What about the two weeks y'owe me... Totally confused, White turns to leave, sees something. HIS P.O.V.  -  A painting on a wall (cheap print variety) waves on a beach.  A breeze rustles the pages of a calend pinned beside the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON WHITE  -  MOVE IN on his ear.  O.S. SOUND  -  su crashes on shore.  A WOMAN'S VOICE WHISPERS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your name...  What is your name... He backs away from the painting, looks about the lobby in -  sees a sign:  TOILETS.  A painted hand points the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! WHITE (without turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back later. MANAGER O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Well, y'better be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA REVEALS A FIGURE  -  watching from a shadowy corne the lobby. As White runs out, the MYSTERY MAN picks up a pay-phone, Whispers into the receiver in a foreign language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White pushes shakily through a red door, runs down a corr Pipes steam and drip water.  He rounds a corner, slips, n falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puddles on the floor, stains on the walls. White bursts through the door and into a cubicle.  He ben over a toilet bowl and VOMITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up, wipes his mouth on his sleeve.  A breeze tug his stringy hair.  A tiny ventilation grill above the cis looks out at the street.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Sheets of newspaper blow past.  A full moon, surrounded b blood red clouds, hangs above empty streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WATCH  -  on a hairy wrist.  Seconds tick past.  Soft flickering light.  VOICES O.S. ANGLE ON FRANK BUMSTEAD  -  police inspector.  He looks d the watch.  Time to leave.  He STANDS, heads for an illum exit sign. Images flicker on a SCREEN.  The inspector rushes to the runs into an USHER, who gasps. BUMSTEAD (to usher)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gesundheit! Bumstead quickly moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INSPECTOR makes a call, licks the tip of a pencil, scribbles in a notebook.  Behind thick glass, he argues soundlessly into a phone. BIG IN FOREGROUND  -  a popcorn machine rattles noisily.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BOOTH
dialogues.text: The inspector is upset, face strained.  A MALE VOICE chat quickly through the receiver. BUMSTEAD (cuts in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but you told me the meeting was ten-thirty. A burst of chatter. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, sir, but I can't make it at nine-thirty...  It's  -  um  -  well, inconvenient... A stream of chatter stops him. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir...  I understand...  Yes... But, I've done fine so far without an assistant... The inspector tries to interject as the VOICE cuts in aga BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...  But I...  I... (defeated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine-thirty.  Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are underwater.  WHITE's FACE swims into view.  Bubble from the mouth,  the eyes stare in horror.

dialogues.speaker: MEN'S ROOM
dialogues.text: White washes his face in a sink.  He looks up, wipes his dry with his coat.  He turns towards the door to leave. There are TWO  -  identical.  He cannot remember which he through.  Takes a guess, opens one and steps into darknes He realizes he's picked the wrong door, tries to go back the door CLICKS behind him:  locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch black.  Trickling water.  A distant voice over a P. system recites names, followed by numbers.  A LIGHT, far White walks towards it. He steps into a bare concrete area, a public phone hangs blank wall.  He pulls a coin from his pocket, puts it in slot, dials the number on his message.  Ringing  -  no an Suddenly White feels cold. VOICE O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are. Startled, White drops the phone and turns.  A figure move forward out of darkness: ANGLE ON THE MYSTERY MAN from the hotel lobby.  The stran wears a long black coat, dark glasses, and has extremely skin.  He is completely bald.  He studies White carefully White glances about nervously  -  walks back up the corri his eyes pinned to the man. MYSTERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are lost, yes? White retreats faster. A FLASH OF STEEL  -  a dagger appears by the stranger's s gripped in a black leather glove.  He moves forward, a gr his pale face. White stops, backs against the wall. MYSTERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Co-operate.  Do not make this difficult. White panics  -  he's cornered.  He remembers the revolve pulls it from his coat and LEVELS it at the stranger, his shakes terribly. ON THE STRANGER continuing to advance.  Something about h eyes makes White immobile, unable to think clearly. MYSTERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will not shoot, yes.  There is a place in your mind, a corner of darkness... THE GUN FIRES again and again.  Red splashes appear on th His shoulder.  His leg.  His neck.  He walks forward, wit spastic jerks as bullets RIP into him. A final shot POINT BLANK into the stranger's forehead.  A stream of black liquid spouts from the hole. Blue smoke clears.  The man stands motionless, his mouth open.  Then his eyes roll up, and he collapses to the gro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICKING of new leather shoes, walking, striking tiles. INSPECTOR BUMSTEAD strides down a silent corridor.  He re into his pocket, removes a SURGICAL MASK, places it over nose and mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumstead steps up to a bald man with a moustache standing the end of the corridor.  The man, who is dressed identic to the inspector, is his superior:  CHIEF-INSPECTOR STROM BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, sir. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  This way. STROMBOLI leads the inspector into a tiled room containin several COVERED BODIES.  The two men are greeted by a che looking MORTICIAN. MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, gentlemen.  YouГ­re early. Here for the examination, right? Stromboli nods, then ignores the mortician and walks alon row of corpses.  Bumstead follows. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The handiwork of an extremely sick individual. He throws back covers to reveal horrible mutilations. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YouГ­ve read the reports.  Not much to go on.  We know nothing about him, except that he likes to cut them... Always the same type of blade. Forensics match in each case... Anyway, it's all in the reports, read them for yourself. STROMBOLI shakes his head, turns away from the final body looks at the inspector. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you wearing that thing on your face? BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Germs, sir.  These places are full of them. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. (continues)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thingГ­s for sure, heГ­s ambitious. YouГ­ll be a busy man from now on. MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can say that again. Stromboli looks annoyed at the smiling man.  The Morticia becomes serious and goes back to his work. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Thompson, sir?  WasnГ­t this his case? STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson suffered a kind of severe delusion or some damn thing.  Anyway he isnГ­t with us any longer.  The case is yours.  Go through his files. Take what you need. (less business-like)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, howГ­s your mother? BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SheГ­s getting better, thanks.  She... STROMBOLI (cuts in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good... The chief-inspector turns, paces to the door briskly. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LetГ­s go, Bumstead.  So much to do and so little time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large faded BILLBOARD advertisement on a building facad portrait of a smiling woman clutching a product called, " O"  -  a cereal box carton. THE CAMERA MOVES IN STEADILY, rises upwards, CLOSER on th womanГ­s face, finally enters a hole at the centre of her PAINTED IRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raftered room on the other side of the billboard.  CAME TILTS TO a convoluted staircase  -  at the base, the SHAD A MAN runs. FEET pace rapidly.  TILT UP TO REVEAL  -  WHITE. CAMERA FOLLOWS as he tries to lose himself from possible pursuers.  He steps through a low archway into a back all rounds a corner. A DEAD-END.  White stops, looks around, then up.  HeГ­s b heavily, trying to catch his breath.  He starts to shake. ABOVE, the walls stretch into darkness.  An OPENING way u there  -  he can see stars.  Something dark crosses the g sky.  A RUSHING NOISE in the distance.  Wind starts to pi Trash is being kicked up.  A sheet of NEWSPAPER wraps aro WhiteГ­s leg.  He tries to kick it away repeatedly but it come off.  He bends down, grabs it to throw it away, but something grabs his eye. He stares at the page for a moment  -  then his LEGS SLIP under him and he falls to the ground.  He holds his head itГ­s going to explode.  A whimper deep in his throat.  H is trembling violently. PUSH IN TIGHT on the paper on the ground.  A front-page headline:  MAN-HUNT CONTINUES FOR SERIAL KILLER! White looks up  -  terrified.  The RUSHING NOISE O.S. aga HIS P.O.V. ON THE WALL facing him, a DOOR has appeared where moments before there was nothing.  The door creaks open to reveal ANOTHER DOOR WITHIN.  This one extends outwards on the en lengthening wooden shaft. White, stands quickly, thrusts the newspaper into a pocke Tries to side-step the ADVANCING DOOR but itГ­s too late, only open it and step through, to avoid getting pinned to wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAND-HELD P.O.V. THROUGH the swaying beads hanging in the room doorway.  TWO FIGURES peer into the room. FIGURE 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking for Jonathan White. THE HOTEL MANAGER looks up, moves forward into light:  a hunch-backed man with glasses.  He steps through the bead glares at the intruders. MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? ON THE MEN  -  an uncanny resemblance to the one who trie kill White.  Black coats, glasses, pale skin.  Creepy. A BLACK GLOVED HAND flashes forward, grips the managerГ­s and doesnГ­t let go.  The manager struggles, gulps for ai HeГ­s pushed back heavily against the wall. MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which room is he in? The leather glove SQUEEZES, blood trickles from the manag ears, through the fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER (VERY SHORT) FIGURE is searching the room.  He he NOISES O.S. in the corridor, runs to the door, presses ag the wall. ON THE MAN  -  FREDRICK  -  a stunted body, an oversized thick limbs.  The rest of his features lost in shadow. The door swings open, a shaft of light floods the dark ro ON THE TWO MYSTERY MEN as they step in and look around. search the room, knock stuff over.  One of the men kicks womanГ­s corpse in the corner.  Behind him, Fredrick, sti hiding near the door, slips into the corridor unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: A FLYING PERSPECTIVE past buildings.  An INSECT-LIKE BUZZ O.S.  Way down BELOW, in a canyon of silent buildings, a FIGURE walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A breeze pulls at WHITEГ­s hair and coat.  He takes out t wallet  -  a few dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city is DEAD.  Empty.  Desolate.  Buildings hang down of black.  Day-time was never invented. As he puts the wallet back in his pocket, a BUSINESS CARD hadnГ­t noticed, flutters to the ground.  He stops, picks In simple print:  DOCTOR D.P. SCHREBER M.D., a phone numb Scribbled handwriting on the back says:  Thursday 0930. ON WHITE  -  he glances across the street. HIS P.O.V.  -  A cafe.  A broken NEON FISH buzzes above t doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks up rickety stairs, into a small room with five o tables.  Empty.  Dirty.  He sits and waits. A CLOCK ticks on the wall  -  midnight.  White coughs, fo attention. A NOISE from a doorway.  A SHADOW moves towards him, drag one foot as it walks.  A SMALL ASIAN WOMAN appears and li his table.  She speaks very quickly IN CHINESE.  He does understand. She points to a chalk board on the wall  -  a list of dis also in Chinese, only one in English  -  the last one.  A bottom.  In small print.  "NOODLES". WHITE (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noodles.  IГ­ll have some noodles. The old woman rips a YELLOW TICKET from a pad, gives it t White.  A number on it.  She points her crooked finger ag at a SPEAKER BOX above a small serving window in the wall greenish fluoro pulses from the room within. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call. She leaves again. White looks about the empty room.  Insects are zapped on illuminated DEVICE hanging on the wall.  An old air-condi RATTLES noisily. NOISES from the kitchen  -  voices argue in Chinese, a ba cries.  Then SILENCE. White removes the newspaper from his coat and spreads it table. He overcomes his fear, starts to read the article.  Leans forward, hands trembling.  Without realising, he holds th paper OVER A CANDLE burning on the table.  The paper CATC FIRE, is engulfed.  He drops the flaming page on the tabl the table-cloth starts to burn. White is frantic.  On a nearby table he finds a pitcher o water, and dumps this on the flames.  It kills the fire b leaves a black hole in the table-cloth.  The paper is ash He moves to another table pretending nothing happened, fa smoke away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD is moving quickly.  He suddenly trips and falls floor.  He curses under his breath, then looks up. HIS P.O.V. A door  -  THOMPSON:  DETECTIVE/INSPECTOR on the frosted Bumstead stands, pushes into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A total mess  -  paperwork everywhere, dozens of used cof cups, rotting food in greasy paper bags.  Bumstead shakes head. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real shame... He starts to look around. TIGHT ON FILING CABINET  -  a drawer is pulled open. ThompsonГ­s files are also a mess.  Bumstead continues to his head.  He reaches for a file.  A loud SNAP! BUMSTEAD (screams)

dialogues.speaker: YAAAAAAAAAH
dialogues.text: He recoils.  A mousetrap has snapped over his fingers.  H pulls it off his hand, throws it to the floor, cursing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White is still waiting for his food. He leans down to scratch an itchy ankle, lifts his trouse to examine the bites  -  worse, inflamed.  He uses a napk wipe at the pus. AERIAL PERSPECTIVE OF A FLY  -  circling the room, lookin on White. ON THE FLY  -  It lands on a plate of half eaten food on another table.  The creature is some kind of SURVEILLANCE DEVICE  -  half insect/half machine.  ItГ­s spying on him IN TIGHT as inbuilt camera lenses focus in its head.  It on the food behind it. White is oblivious to this.  HeГ­s finished examining his is sitting quietly.  He yawns.  His head nods forward bri A NOISE.  White looks up. A TRAP-DOOR has opened in the ceiling.  Two feet in black leather shoes descend from the hole.  A sea breeze blows through the room.  The SOUND OF SURF, SEAGULLS CRYING. ON WhiteГ­s nose twitching.  He can smell the ocean. The WALLPAPER COMES ALIVE  -  like a seething tangle of w One by one, THREE MEN in black coats lower into the room, floating on air.  They pull out knifes, step forward. ON WHITE rigid with terror. ON THE MEN  -  though their faces cannot be seen clearly gloom, they too resemble the MAN who confronted White ear They walk towards him slowly, holding knifes above their Ready to attack.  They lean over him, pause dramatically. MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DonГ­t fall asleep. (chuckles softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might never wake, yes. This Man turns to the others.  They all smile, then turn to White. MEN (in unison)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty-six. ANOTHER VOICE has been speaking softly  -  now it is loud Repeating: VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty-six...  Fifty-six... ANGLE  -  a chair falls to the floor. White leaps up from the table, terrified, disoriented.  J DREAM  -  he had dozed. WIDEN ANGLE  -  The place is still empty.  White glances serving window.  A DISH waits for him, framed in the glow fluoro square.  He gets it.  A bowl of soupy liquid with noodles.  He sits down. He is about to start eating  -  realizes he has a fork in of a spoon.  Picking up the bowl again, he heads to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a door beneath a set of wooden stairs and finds himself in another corridor.  He looks about, unsure whic direction to go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White is lost, still holding the soup. He moves through a number of RUSTED METAL DOORS that open shut automatically.  Each reveals another room or corrido Deserted spaces long forgotten  -  dusty, crumbling. He feels the fish moving about in his pocket, pulls it ou looks at it. White holds the dying fish in one hand, the bowl of cold in the other.  Disgusted, he puts the fish into the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: A TICKING SOUND O.S.
dialogues.text: White stops.  Looks up.  A large clock suspended from the rafters.  A tug at his coat. Standing beside him is FREDRICK  -  the little man from W hotel room. FREDRICK (stutters)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been?  The doctorГ­s been worried about you. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Who are you? Fredrick looks nervously down the corridor. FREDRICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CГ­mon, letГ­s go!  We donГ­t have any time. The little man grabs WhiteГ­s sleeve, starts to pull him WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it a minute.  LetГ­s start at the beginning, huh? ANGLE ON  -  the top of a set of stairs in front of them. dark figures appear. Fredrick looks up at them in horror. FRERICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! (looks at White)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick!  Run! Both men run like crazy, White awkwardly holding the bowl soup.  They come to a junction, each takes a separate cor Fredrick finds some stairs, climbs two at a time. White climbs INTO FRAME, looks around, finds another corr The little man is nowhere to be seen.  White reaches anot junction  -  several corridors branch off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each passageway completely deserted.         WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.                                        He keeps running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PHOTO FLASH  -  illuminates the dead body of the hotel slumped in his own blood. Bumstead leans INTO FRAME, examines the corpse.  He notic several stab wounds in the manГ­s abdomen.  Various cops the room. One cop walks up to the Inspector. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got another one upstairs BUMSTEAD (deadpan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL ROOM with arched windows that look over the city. Fredrick is pulling a notebook and pen from under an uptu table. He scrawls rapidly, screws the message into a tight tube, puts it into a METAL CYLINDER he finds beneath the table He glances out a window, notices A FIGURE standing beneat street-lamp below, looking up at him.  Startled, Fredrick back into shadow, goes to a wall covered in about a dozen vertical PIPES running up into the ceiling. TIGHT ON ONE OF THE PIPES  -  he opens a small hatch and the metal cylinder in it.  The cylinder is snatched from hand, sucked into the pipe with a rush of air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fredrick steps back, a sigh of relief.  A shadow falls ac his back.  He turns.  He screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT  -  rushing along lengths of rusted pipe, at blindi speed.  The cylinder races around corners.  It clanks and grinds.  HURTLES up the side of a building.  THEN PLUMMET underground.  Rushes through darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA MOVES along a bridge-like structure.  An enclo corridor supported by rotting wooden pylons.  Under the b pipes spew sewage into stagnant water. ANGLE ON WHITE WALKING  -  seen through a series of illum dirty, windows.  He occasionally glances into the bowl he before him.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON the fish swimming weakly in the soup. ANGLE ON WHITE  -  He stops, looks up at O.S. SOUND of clattering metal.  A pipe runs the length of the corridor the invisible clanging cylinder races away, into darkness Then the silence is shattered by a piercing series of SCR somewhere in the building.  White hurriedly moves towards source.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: White rounds a corner, stops, notices a small rectangular in a wall.  ANOTHER SCREAM, weaker now  -  He runs to the in the wall and looks through. HIS P.O.V. A small, very ordered ROOM.  A fake fireplace bathes the in a warm glow. White cranes his neck forward, stretches his head through hole.  He can see into an adjoining room to his right  - dark figures stand over a man on the floor lying in a poo dark crimson.  The man looks up  -  itГ­s Fredrick  -  ju both dark figures stab him repeatedly with bloody daggers doesnГ­t scream this time, just gags on blood running fro mouth. Suddenly a sliding door SLAMS onto the back of WhiteГ­s n traps his head in the hole.  He struggles, tries to free himself.  Drops the bowl of soup.  It shatters on the har floor, makes a mess. INSIDE THE BATHROOM  -  The killers look up at the smashi noise. BACK IN THE CORRIDOR  -  White pulls with all his strengt The door gives and he stumbles backwards.  He is about to away but glances at the floor. The fish is flapping about  -  still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White darts from a doorway, trips and falls.  He sprawls base of sweeping stone steps.  He looks at a building tow above him.  Chiselled in the facade, above the entrance: LIBRARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of ply-wood SILHOUETTES race through frame.  Sto suddenly, mechanically.  LOUD GUNSHOTS.  Chunks of ply-wo blast away violently. BUMSTEAD is practising his marksmanship. A HAND  -  on his shoulder.  He whips around, startled. ON MISS CRENSHAW  -  a young, stiff-looking woman. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit! MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DonГ­t ever sneak up on me like that! Who are you? MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patricia Crenshaw. She puts out her hand. MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IГ­m your new assistant. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didnГ­t requisition a secretary. MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief-Inspector thought you might need a hand. BUMSTEAD (uncertain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. He takes her hand tentatively.  They shake. MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IГ­ve taken the liberty and had Inspector ThompsonГ­s office searched, as I believe you instructed.  All clear now, sir.  They found several more traps and things were filed under pretty strange categories... Poor man. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wonГ­t regret this, sir. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Bumstead moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White steps into a vast, empty room, stops beneath a big saying, SILENCE in formal letters.  The place seems aband then he notices a hint of movement.  Cigarette smoke snak into the air, a light, across the expanse of polished flo He walks up to an elderly female LIBRARIAN sitting behind desk, smoking, reading.  White looks somewhat distraught WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep newspapers here, birth certificates, records of deaths, that kind of thing? The librarian looks up from her book. LIBRARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which would you like first? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Newspapers. She takes her glasses off.  Her eyes are TINY, like pin-h She studies White. LIBRARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright? He looks around  -  restrained panic. WHITE (looks at the woman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  IГ­m fine. LIBRARIAN (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm-hmm.  Stairs at the end of the hall.  Third floor.  Turn left. Section C-7.  Row 35, near the toilets. She replaces her glasses, watches White rush away. LIBRARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DonГ­t mention it... She blows her nose into a handkerchief.  The snort ECHOES LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White rushes down a dark hall lined with bronze statues. finds section C then walks between towering rows stacked old volumes.  Comes to number 7. He follows an arrow past row after row  -  finally finds but then it skips straight to letters again, A, B, C, etc No Row 35. He stops and looks around  -  sure enough a door displays small sign:  TOILETS. White is sweating profusely.  He now sits on a chair, tak his shoes, rubs his feet.  He pulls a book from a shelf b him, looks about, opens the book and tears several pages folds them, stuffs them into his shoes to plug up the hol He gets up, tries to backtrack, comes across an elaborate diagram of the library interior.  An arrow points to a se near a wing labelled:  MAPS.  Near the arrow it says:  YO HERE. He keeps walking. He finds the door to the maps wing but the door is locked sign is nailed to it:  WE ARE REMODELLING.  WE APOLOGIZE INCONVENIENCE. White, annoyed now, tries to force his way in.  Puts his shoulder to the door, pushes several times.  It CRUMBLES his weight  -  rotten. He finds himself in a DUSTY ROOM. HIS P.O.V. A narrow room, filled with rows of bookshelves with stack old newspapers. TIGHT ON WHITE  -  he steps forward, pulls a folded newsp off the shelf.  The instant he picks it up, it crumbles t in his hands.  He picks up another, and another, each in breaking apart and dissolving to nothingness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SILHOUETTED FIGURES face each other across a polished table.  They speak in a foreign language.  A phone rings. Figure 1 picks up the receiver and listens attentively. Figure 2 is involved with various metal shapes he is tryi lock together.  A complex puzzle.  He gets impatient with puzzle, dashes it to the floor. Figure 1, on the phone, hangs up and writes something.  H the note to Figure 2, who in turn drops it into A CHUTE.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: The note falls from a slot in the wall before Figure 3 (i shadow yet again).  He reads from the note over a silver microphone, still in the unfamiliar tongue. TIGHT ON A SPEAKER  -  his distorted voice.  A final myst person  -  Figure 4  -  listens to the announcement.  He a stick and moves a small cut-out figure of a man across board, away from a large grouping of similar cut-outs.  T board resembles a planning table in a war-room. A HIGH ANGLE as the CAMERA PULL BACKS on the grouping of out figures.  More and more of them.  Ten.  Twenty.  A hu A sinister army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White is in a phone booth.  He removes the note from his pocket, dials.  No answer again.  He dials the OPERATOR. muffled voice over the line. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IГ­m trying to reach nine zero eight triple two.  I canГ­t get through... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!... (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! He reaches into his pocket, pulls out a coin, puts it int slot.  HeГ­s sweating again.  He wipes his brow with a tr hand. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is?...  Which area is that number listed in?...  Is that near the ocean?...  The ocean...  Never mind. Have a Jonathan White listed?... WHITE.  Seventeen?  All Johns?  I see...  Never mind. He hangs up, then removes the business card he found in h wallet.  He is about to dial but decides otherwise.  He s into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White walks between tall buildings, towards a narrow stre that branches off into two separate routes.  He stops.  H canГ­t decide which branch to take  -  he steps to the le then steps back, takes a few steps to the right, reconsid again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK ALONG  -  piles of towering files bursting at the s with paperwork  -  TO FIND Bumstead hunched over notes, photographs and files.  His eyes are rimmed with red.  He doesnГ­t seem to be getting anywhere. CRENSHAW O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee? He looks up.  The secretary stands in the doorway with an big pile of paperwork. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  I donГ­t drink coffee.  A cup of tea would be good.  Milk and no sugar. Crenshaw puts the paperwork down on BumsteadГ­s already overcrowded desk. CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making progress? He looks at her like she just slapped him. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the investigations of a madman.  He has fabricated an entire bizarre paranoid delusion with no internal logic whatever. (without looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a mess.  A horrible mess. (looks at her now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItГ­s the second time now. Miss Crenshaw looks concerned. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this! He holds up a sheet of white paper  -  a report.  The wom steps over and looks at it. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You typed this report? MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  Anything wrong? BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong?  Look at this! The woman bends down, adjusts her glasses, examines it. MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems fine. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine?  Look here! His finger points at the bottom of the page  -  a tiny, INSIGNIFICANT ink smudge. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I submit this? MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IГ­m sorry... BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you wash your hands before you type things? MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, yes. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well be more careful, please. An embarrassed beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: RI-I-I-ING
dialogues.text: Bumstead reaches for the phone but Crenshaw is on it firs CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector BumsteadГ­s office... Yes...  Yes... She cups the receiver with her hand, looks at Bumstead. MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  The Chief-Inspector said he would see you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING SHOT towards a door:  CHIEF-INSPECTOR on the fro glass.  A hand reaches INTO FRAME, knocks twice. STROMBOLI O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enter!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Bumstead steps into the office  -  finds STROMBOLI wander about the room, distracted, searching for something... STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? He pulls the waste-basket up and empties the contents ont desk, sorts through it. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A formality.  I need to speak with Thompson.  Officially I need your written permission. Stromboli is looking through his desk drawers now. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want to speak to him? BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hunch.  He might be able to... STROMBOLI (from under desk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumstead, donГ­t be so paranoid. Leave him alone  -  heГ­s a sad case. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItГ­s extremely important to my investigation... STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IГ­ll be the judge of that.  Anything else? BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I was wondering, sir, if you could let me have a few uniforms, to follow up for me... STROMBOLI O.S. (pokes head above desk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.  Up to my ears in cases right now  -  canГ­t spare anyone. Stromboli becomes distracted again  -  stands up, looks b pictures hanging off the walls.  A big sign suspended abo desk says, SO MUCH TO DO AND SO LITTLE TIME  -  his motto BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost something? STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think that!  If you would learn to concentrate on facts, not get so side-tracked  -  you might get things done faster, Bumstead... The door clicks shut.  Stromboli looks up  -  the inspect gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White walks under stone archways. Across an empty plaza is a sign above a door:   DRUGS OPE HOURS and in smaller print, recently added beneath:   SHA HAIRCUT $5.00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White walks between bare, dusty shelves.  Only one shelf carries products  -  BOX AFTER BOX OF "LUMP-O".  He moves a small counter.  A man with thick glasses, dressed like BARBER, is seated there. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need something to keep me awake. BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you need a haircut to me. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  Just some pills. BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only two bucks.  Shave as well... WHITE (annoyed now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your sign says you sell drugs  - well, IГ­m here to buy some.  Okay? BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax.  Sure! He waves dramatically to a shelf above his head, with sev bottles of all sorts of different coloured capsules. BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what  -  let me cut yer hair, give ya watcha need half price. CanГ­t argue at that! WHITE (evenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I donГ­t want a haircut.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS OFF a clock on a wall  -  REVEALS WHITE in barber chair.  The BARBER gleefully works on WHITEГ­s hai thin OLD GUY in a moth-eaten suit steps from behind a cur smiles, playing a violin.  HeГ­s passionate but bad. BARBER (talks fast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut hair when I was in the navy, yГ­know  -  havenГ­t lost the touch. Bet youГ­re happy Г«bout that.  Huh! WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sell maps? BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What of? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city.  I need to get to the ocean. BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.  No maps.  Ocean, huh?  On vacation? White doesnГ­t answer.  The old guy with the violin moves and forth behind White, smiling as he plays. BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa thought customers might like some mood music. WHITE (unconvinced)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice... BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still look familiar.  ItГ­s driving me nuts!  Sure I donГ­t know ya from somewhere? WHITE (nervous now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me. Barber looks out the front window as his hands busily tri hair. BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mnunn.  Cold lately. (lathers up WhiteГ­s face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night, couple weeks ago.  That was real cold.  Remember that? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really... BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, IГ­m like that.  Senility says the wife.  But she sure canГ­t complain.  Heh.  The erector set still works good. (points to head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this ainГ­t no fucking rug! GГ­head.  Feel it!  All mine! Grandpa laughs and plays louder. GRANDPA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Feeeeel it! PUSH IN ON WHITE  -  he smiles weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND scrawls cryptic diagrams into a notebook.

dialogues.speaker: PULL OUT TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: DOCTOR SCHREBER at his desk.  HeГ­s bearded, with thick l glasses.  He puts the phone down, sits quietly at his des staring into space, lost in thought. A LOUD RATTLING NOISE FILLS THE ROOM.  Schreber looks up. HIS P.O.V. A rusted pipe runs across the ceiling and down one wall. steps across to the pipe on the wall, leans down, looks i open hatch at its base. Without warning, out of the hatch pops the metal cylinder SEVERAL SCENES PREVIOUS and bounces off the doctor's head He curses, picks it up, opens it.  He plucks out the note reads FREDRICKГ­s SCRAWLED MESSAGE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schreber looks up  -  then PUNCHES HIS FIST into the desk angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A P.O.V. MOVES DOWN halls made of wood slatting  -  the f walls and ceilings are bare boards.  FOOTSTEPS O.S. TIGHT ON  -  a manГ­s shadow as it descends a wooden stai REVEAL WHITE  -  He rummages in a paper bag as he walks. out two capsules, swallows them.  Now he pulls out a pack "LUMP-O", rips it open, eats ravenously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White steps out into a street, turns a corner, drops the packet of cereal.  Now he sees TWO FIGURES APPROACH.  He behind a wall before he is seen.  Suddenly a deafening RI startles him.  He looks across a plaza. HIS P.O.V.  -  A CHURCH.  A bell-tower, black against the White stares up into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White walks in, sits on A PEW, towards the back of the ro glances over his shoulder.  He tries to blend in with the GATHERING OF PEOPLE sitting silently around him. A PRIEST  -  appears at the altar, cloaked in a blood-red followed by two altar boys also in red.  They move past a statue of an insect-like creature, walk in circles chanti softly, stop and stare at the congregation through eye-sl their hoods.  The priest begins his sermon. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beware!  The night is deadly.  There is a criminal among us. White looks forward. TIGHT ON the priestГ­s hand  -  It rises, points, moves o heads of the congregation, accusingly.  Suddenly the red jabs towards an OLD WOMAN in the front row. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be she!  The innocent across the street! All the congregation turn and stare at the woman.  SheГ­s terrified. The hand moves slowly now, across to a BEAUTIFUL JAPANESE several rows back. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or the temptress next door! The priest pauses dramatically then: PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or mister nervy stranger at the back! Suddenly the finger is pointing at White. All the faces t stare suspiciously at White. ANGLE ON WHITE  -  frozen with fright.  Fortunately his f obscured by shadow and the priest lowers his hand, contin the sermon.  The people look away. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are thinking it could be anyone? And youГ­re right!  Why, it could even be Mother! White goes to leave.  As he stands he notices the DOORS o church open  -  two figures step in and move into the can light. MYSTERY MEN  -  WhiteГ­s bizarre pursuers.  They look aro White ducks down, crawls between pews, startling several congregation.  He motions to them to keep quiet.  He runs the legs of the BEAUTIFUL WOMAN the priest pointed out. startled momentarily but looks down at him, smiles. PRIEST (continues sermon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evil stalks our streets.  It seeks to hide in our hearts.  Have you not evil within you now? White sees a nearby CONFESSION BOX.  Staying low, he runs almost knocks over a large illuminated candle-holder, dar inside.  The girl watches him. A GAUNT-FACED WOMAN stands.  Hysterical.  She looks at th priest. GAUNT WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took my little boy!  IГ­ll rip out his eyes! INSIDE  -  White breaths relief. HIS P.O.V.  -  carved on the dark stained wood in front o is a crucified insect.  A voice surprises him.  Another P OLDER. OLDER PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have sinned? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO.  Ah... White watches the two Mystery Men walk past, through the wooden grill in front of his face. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am listening. WHITE (lying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThereГ­s a...  woman.  I don't know but I think I, ahh... PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fornicated? The Mystery Men look towards the box for a moment, toward White, but keep walking. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I, ah... PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem restless. The Mystery Men seem to have gone.  White takes out the g keeping it hidden from the priest.  Opens the chamber. TIGHT ON THE GUN  -  Only ONE BULLET left. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SomeoneГ­s after me. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we must call the police. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I mean...  that isnГ­t necessary. The silhouette on the other side of the box leans forward PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.  Then who is after you?  What sins have you committed? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me sit here for a moment? IГ­ll go soon, and stop bothering you. The priest suddenly stares incredulously at White.  His e widen in horror. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YouГ­re the murderer? (starts to yell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  That must be it!  DonГ­t kill me! White lunges, grabs his collar with one hand, slaps the o over his mouth.  The old man stares at him, trembling uncontrollably. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  Listen.  Walk out quietly. (holds up gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understand? The priest nods stupidly.  White pushes him out of the confession box, grabs his coat from behind, puts the gun back.  Together they head for the doors.  Still no sign o Mystery Men. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DonГ­t kill me! WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... White loses his temper, grabs the priest, shakes him viol WHITE (not so quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IГ­m not going to kill you, okay! Faces turn. The priest kicks White in the leg, bites his hand.  While is wincing in pain, the priest breaks away. PRIEST (shouting/pointing)

dialogues.speaker: CRIMINAL
dialogues.text: People start to scream and run.  The GAUNT WOMAN points a White. GAUNT WOMAN (screams insanely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItГ­s him!  Rip out his eyes! Frightened, White holds the gun out.  Everyone panics, scatters.  People run for the exit.  Religious statues to and smash.  The gaunt woman is pushed screaming to the fl trampled by the crowd. Amidst the chaos, the two MYSTERY MEN appear across the r see White, head towards him.  He turns and runs.

dialogues.speaker: A STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: White climbs narrow stairs rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White stops, nowhere left to go, just a long drop to the through a series of arched windows.  A low, raftered room three huge black BELLS. Suddenly a groan of gears in the ceiling and the bells st swing, build momentum. CLANG!  CLA-A-A-ANG!  A cacophony of noise. White puts his hands over his ears in pain, then turns to stairs. HIS P.O.V. Through the swinging bells  -  the MYSTERY MEN climb the few steps on the other end of the dark room.  They advanc slowly, clutching daggers. White raises his gun.  Aims.  Difficult to find his targe the approaching MEN are obscured by the bells. White steps sideways, never taking his eyes off the Men. follow him slowly, pivoting about the bells in the centre the tower, pursuers and pursued remaining a semi-circle a WHITE (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?  Tell me! The Men stop.  So does White.  They separate, now approac him from OPPOSITE sides, moving around the bells. White doesnГ­t know who to point the gun at  -  he swings and forth, one to the other, faster and faster, as the Me approach. He lets them get uncomfortably close, then swings to his thrusts the gun to one ManГ­s forehead.  FIRES.  The Man back, spouting liquid from the bullet hole, hits a low ra FALLS into the shaft at the centre of the tower. The second Man SWINGS his dagger at White. White falls backwards, dropping his gun clumsily.  The Ma advances, smiling  -  kicks the gun across the wooden flo White, clutching at straws, lifts his foot, kicks down ha a loose floorboard.  The board flies up, pivoting against WhiteГ­s heel, catches the Mystery Man with a CRACK under chin. White runs at the off-balance Man, head-butts him in the stomach.  The Man recoils, canГ­t stop, steps off backwar space, PLUMMETS INTO DARKNESS towards the street below. White relieved, turns, dusts himself, picks up his gun. down at the floor.  Broken glass and capsules everywhere dropped the bottle of pills during the scuffle.  Starts t them up. Behind him SOMETHING is rising. The shadowy Mystery Man is LEVITATING HIMSELF back up to bell-tower.  He lands behind White, approaches, lifting h dagger, closer and closer. White glances around. The Man lunges, pushing White towards the shaft beneath t swinging bells.  White FALLS, dangles over dark space, th stands above him. MYSTERY MAN (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not make us hurt you... The bells are swinging very close to the Man. MYSTERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be inconvenient, yes... Suddenly, to WhiteГ­s amazement, the shiny black rim of a clips the ManГ­s head.  SLAMS it against a low wooden bea the ceiling.  A splash of black liquid.  The Man slumps t ground, his head crushed beyond recognition. White pulls himself up  -  stands over the ManГ­s body, t to decide what to do.  A MOVEMENT catches his eye. TIGHT ON the collapsed ManГ­s ear  -  something moves ins BLACK INSECT, half-dead, crawls out of his crushed head. White revolted, SQUASHES the insect under his shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAPID MOVE ACROSS MYSTERY MEN screaming.  Faces contort w pain.  INTERCUT WITH: Electricity ARCING between electrodes. A building against the sky.  The windows EXPLODE.  Glass out, raining down on the street. A concrete wall SPLITS OPEN.  Slime oozes through the cra An old man, walks on a deserted street, looks up at the s One of the lenses of his spectacles CRACKS without warnin A chair falls over in a dark room. A woman under a hair-dryer gossips on a phone.  Suddenly phone emits a high-pitched shriek.  Her ear spouts blood she screams. A small transistor radio emits a high frequency and short circuits with a spark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON  -  a wristwatch spinning backwards rapidly  - completely haywire. INSPECTOR BUMSTEAD stands on a street corner staring blan his watch.  Taps it several times, annoyed, then looks up THREE STOREY BUILDING.  He holds a piece of paper in his hand  -  on it a number rapidly scrawled:  23. HIS P.O.V. The dilapidated building  -  arched windows only on the t floor.  A faded number on the facade  -  also 23.  The wi light up continuously with rapid bursts of white light.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: The inspector climbs a staircase, enters a dark room. TWO FIGURES move about.  Bumstead glances at a UNIFORMED standing beside a fake fire, who acknowledges his arrival To the side, A POLICE PHOTOGRAPHER flashes something swin back and forth, hanging from the ceiling.  It looks like. Fredrick.  Dead.  His arms and legs missing.  A pool of b beneath the mutilated torso. Bumstead looks at the cop. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been here? COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe ten minutes... (looks at his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatГ­s strange. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinning backwards? The cop is shaking his watch, tapping it with his finger. looks up.  Bumstead indicates his own watch. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours too? Bumstead nods.  He removes a notebook from his pocket, wa about the room, glances at objects, makes notes. Bumstead steps over to a small RECTANGULAR HOLE in the wa He examines it carefully, then bends down and puts his he through.  On the other side is a corridor snaking off int darkness.  Just beneath the hole, is a broken dish and a puddle.  Lying half in the puddle is the business card of Doctor D.P. Schreber M.D. Without removing his head from the hole he shouts to the cop. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want prints over here... Suddenly the door has caught BumsteadГ­s head in it.  He struggles.  The cop and the photographer run over to help

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE IN ON a doorway.  Above it a small illuminated red s DOCTOR D.P. SCHREBER M.D.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE
dialogues.text: He stands on the street, under the sign, rummaging in his wallet, obviously looking for the business card he doesnГ anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white room, bare.  Dirt stains the walls near the air-v A NURSE is typing behind her desk. A THUMPING fills the room.  The nurse stands, removes her and hits a pipe running along the wall several times.  Th noise stops. The front door creaks open and White enters.  She watches step into the room. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see the doctor.  It's important. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time was your appointment? WHITE (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!  Tell him I'm here.  Now. He's leaning across her desk threateningly. NURSE (scared/standing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, certainly...  Who should I say? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea.  Just get him... Suddenly a door opens and DOCTOR SCHREBER, clutching a fi papers, steps out.  He freezes, stares at White.  The pap fall from his hands to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of DARK SILHOUETTES file into a concrete room. The MYSTERY MEN have gathered.  Like the Men who pursue W they wear coats, leather gloves, dark glasses, and have n white skin. One MAN points to diagrams on a chalk board and speaks in peculiar foreign tongue. TIGHT ON THE DIAGRAM  -  a path through the city.  A circ marks the point where the red line ends  -  a cathedral. Man goes into broken English  -  a guttural accent. MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has failed. ANOTHER MAN stands at the rear of the room. MAN 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is becoming dangerous, yes! YET ANOTHER MAN starts to tremble violently, seized with kind of convulsion.  He froths at the mouth and throws hi about.  A TALLER MAN standing beside him opens a silver b removes a small WRITHING WORM.  He places this on the tip the trembling Man's tongue, who swallows it and calms dow MAN 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get this over with. ANOTHER MAN rises suddenly, pushes forcefully to the fron the group. MAN 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the dance-steps!  This is my responsibility, we must resolve this issue, yes? THE MEN turn to face him.  He is out of line.  He becomes irritated, as if to say something further, then pulls him short, sits down. MAN 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. MAN 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The situation has changed. (pacing the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one is in possession of knowledge... MAN 1 (cuts in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to avoid influence, yes. MAN 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A freak! MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible! RUMBLING NOISE O.S. attracts everyone's attention.  They look to a round portal high on a wall.  The noise is loud several figures on stilts run past outside the opening  - the noise subsides.  The MYSTERY MEN go back to more impo things. MAN 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets interesting, yes. MAN 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop this!  It has gone too far! Tell Mister Black! Man 2 stares blankly into space, he makes a peculiar clic noise with his mouth, his eyes roll upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA GLIDES down a corridor, towards a door  -  a s says, DOCTOR IS:  IN.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: White sits in a leather chair across from an ornate woode desk.  THE DOCTOR paces up and down in front of glass jar containing preserved specimens.  He stops, looks at White SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember nothing?  Who you are? What you've done? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know something about me? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, that would be cheating, wouldn't it? (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there nothing you remember?  Not even a detail?   You must try. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I haven't been trying! (calms himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like there was never anything there. (pauses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just water. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waves...  A beach.  A woman whispering.  That's all. (looks up, yawns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to stay awake.  Do you have any pills? The doctor walks to a glass cabinet and removes a bottle, out two green capsules.  Hands them to White.  Sits behin desk again. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does she say?  The woman. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asks my name.  Over and over.  Just like a broken record.  Only thing is, I can't answer.  I've no idea what my name is. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name is John White. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what people keep telling me. Te doctor walks to a small sink in the corner, returns, h White a glass of water.  White swallows the pills. SCHREBER  (indicates pills)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's this about?  Why? White stands up, starts to pace nervously. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad dreams? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about them... WHITE (interrupts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, why don't I ask some questions for a change. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you like. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to be my doctor, right? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  I am your doctor. White is very agitated now, his voice is getting edgy. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Known me for long? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... WHITE (cuts in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I a killer? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot say...  You don't know the answer to that? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I can't remember a thing! White reaches across abruptly, GRABS the doctor. WHITE  (angry now  -  shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you know something about me, out with it!  Let's end this bullshit!  I want answers! The doctor is obviously scared. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't get anywhere like this. Please.  Let's take things in easy steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON DRAWING PINS  -  Being pushed into a map.  A see random pattern across the terrain of the city.  Each pin labelled:  VICTIM 1, VICTIM 2,...  etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's tired, like he hasn't slept.  He's looking at the ma stuck to a wall.  There's several neat piles of folders o kitchen table in front of him.  The kitchen itself is incredibly neat  -  everything completely organized. Bumstead shakes his head slowly, turns away from the boar Picks up a cup of hot tea, pours milk into it from a smal TIGHT ON THE TEA CUP  -  Cream SWIRLS into a rapidly diss spiral.  Bumstead looks up.  Puts down the cup hurriedly, back to the map. With a thick pen he traces a line between each point mark the location of the victims.  He steps back to examine hi handiwork. A SPIRAL  -  moving outwards.  Beyond the last victim it becomes a dotted line, following the same trajectory but big question mark beside it. Bumstead glances over to a blackboard with a list of name addresses on it.  He holds up the doctor's card and stare it.  He turns it over, notices an address on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHREBER is showing WHITE a series of CHARTS.  The doctor nervous about White's potential for further violence. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put simply...  a penetration of the left parieto-occipital area of the cranium...  complicated by inflammation that resulted in adhesions of the brain to the meninges.  Without going into detail...  the formation of scar tissue altered the configuration of the lateral ventricles, producing incipient atrophy of the medulla... WHITE (cuts in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  It was a simple question.  Can someone kill and not remember it? SCHREBER (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I get carried away sometimes.  Possible?  I'm...  ah, afraid so. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she drown?  The woman you told me about? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly.  She was found in a canal, disembowelled.  Throat cut. Blood drained.  The body wrapped in a bed-sheet. White shakes his head, looking blankly at the doctor. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrible... SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember nothing, eh? (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you something. Schreber turns, points to DOUBLE-DOORS.  He walks towards these.  White follows. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Formation of memories is the most important of brain functions.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORS ARE OPENED
dialogues.text: They step into a room of living animal experiments. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are little more than a sum of memories.  From them we reference who we are, where we're going.  Without a past we are nothing.  This is why you are so interesting. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm nothing then. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything but, my friend. The two men look down on a monkey with the top of its hea missing, squirming in a mechanical device that restricts movements. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels no pain. White turns and starts to pace away.  Schreber reluctantl follows. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get my life back? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Schreber points dramatically at a wooden structure contai two rats. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know of two kinds of memory. Firstly, declarative memory. The rats perform various activities involving mazes and geometric symbols.  Schreber turns to look at White, eyeb raised. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then there is procedural memory. TIGHT ON HIS SLENDER FINGER  -  pointing to a machine als by rats.  The object is to make it through a guillotine d One rat is successful, the other is chopped neatly in two SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow? White nods. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Research on simple animals can be... useful.  To show us where memory storing systems are located, for example.  I am building an experiment with hamsters next. (looks at nearby cage of hamsters)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute little things. Schreber puts a hand on White's shoulder. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me talk!  You must be hungry. White nods again, extremely troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schreber's office is an annex of his living quarters  - maze-like series of rooms and halls.  White is led down a hall by Schreber, clutching a candle. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whole damn wing lost power.  Wiring's old.  Keep meaning to get it fixed. Here we are. They've stopped outside a flaking door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small eat-in kitchen.  Dirty and run-down.  White, sits bench, as Schreber removes items from the refrigerator. doctor holds up a large FROZEN fish. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.  Beautiful!  Head and all!  Just how I like 'em! ANGLE ON FRYING PAN ON STOVE  -  The fish lands in it and to sizzle furiously.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE
dialogues.text: WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  About before. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't blame you for getting angry. You are in a frustrating situation. You must be patient though.  Trust me completely.  I'm here to help. A set of swinging doors on the other side of the room ope slightly and THE NURSE looks in. NURSE (to Schreber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to you. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't wait? She shakes her head, with a serious expression, then dart again. SCHREBER  (to White)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  Ah, make yourself at home. He leaves. Alone, White looks around the bleak room.  He takes off h coat and sits down again.  He removes the FISH.  The eye The creature looks up at him.  It breaths painfully. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still kicking, huh? He puts it back in his pocket. The OTHER fish is spattering oil everywhere.  Smoke start fill the room.  White, steps over and looks at the frying The fish is turning black.  He turns the heat down. He notices a SMALL HOLE in the wall.  At eye height.  He across, looks through. TIGHT ON WHITE'S eye through the hole. HIS P.O.V. A dark room.  Shadows on the wall.  Something wet, some k ANIMAL, moving in the darkness.  He can hear breathing an whispering voices. White's eyes start to blur, he rubs them. SCHREBER O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are things in here? White spins, like he's caught doing something wrong.  The Doctor walks across to the stove, prods the frying fish w fork. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, nearly done.  So tell me about your dreams.  I'm very interested. White is having a hard time focusing. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the typical fabrications of a distorted mind.  You know, chased by mysterious men in black, that kind of thing... WHITE'S P.O.V.  -  ANGLE ON Schreber with his back turned the stove.  THE IMAGE is blurring. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, our friends in black...  they are not just a figment of your imagination you know, in fact none of what you are experiencing is anything but real. Smoke rises thickly around the doctor. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know everything about you.  You have no choice but to trust me. Flames are shooting up around Schreber from the frying pa His arms catch fire, and he suddenly spins around clutchi flaming daggers in both hands, his whole body engulfed in his face charred, black flesh hanging off his skull. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarey, isn't it? White startles awake. Schreber stands at the stove looking at White.  Everythin normal. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you feeling alright? White stands awkwardly, pulls his coat on. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go... SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go yet.  We've got so much to talk about... Suddenly White feels feint  -  leans against the wall to himself. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're tired.  You need to lie down. ON WHITE  -  swaying. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those pills... HIS P.O.V. The scene is distorted  -  like looking through water.  T start SPINNING. SCHREBER (echoic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  A little something to help you relax.  Harmless... A tile floor RISES rapidly TOWARDS CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: GREY LIMBO
dialogues.text: Objects float underwater.  They rise upwards amidst bubbl break the surface.  A storm at sea  -  dismembered BODY P float all the way to the horizon. TWO FOETUSES in separate jars are talking to each other t the glass. FOETUS 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is madness.  If we're caught... FOETUS 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up.  Help me with these straps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE wakes strapped to an exantination table.  SCHREBER NURSE loom above him.  The nurse hands Schreber a long, c SYRINGE.  The doctor moves towards White. SCHREBER (holds syringe up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you must relax, Anton. A DOOR-BELL RINGS O.S. The nurse makes for the door. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it! He's tapping the side of the syringe, squirting out air bubbles.  THE DOOR-BELL RINGS again  -  very insistent. Schreber looks at the nurse, annoyed. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!  Whoever it is  -  get rid of them! She heads to the door  -  turns back. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keys. Schreber puts the syringe down, fumbles in his pocket, pu out a huge collection of KEYS on a ring, walks to the nur hands them to her. White manages to wriggle a hand free from the leather str holding him.  The nurse leaves, the doctor shuts the door locks it.  He steps over to White. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I had to put you through this, Anton. (lowers syringe to White's forehead)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be some pain, but things will be easier this way. White lashes out, PUNCHES the doctor in the face.  His gl go flying, and he falls to the floor, blinded, scrambling the spectacles. A convenient scalpel cuts White from his remaining bonds. undoes the last strap around his ankles as the doctor rep his glasses and leaps at him trying to drive the syringe WHITE'S FOREHEAD. The struggle continues  -  each man tries to turn the syr on the other.  White pushes the doctor, who falls backwar Schreber leaps onto him, both fall against a tray of medi instruments. A loud THUMPING on the examination room door.  White is g from behind, pinned down with the syringe INCHES from his A CRASH O.S.  Splintering wood.  The door bursts open. A ROTUND SILHOUETTE  -  is revealed, clutching a police special, flashing a badge.  A squeaky, over-excited, voic BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it! Schreber and White FREEZE in mid-struggle, look at the inspector.  Behind him, the nurse appears in the hallway. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police.  Nobody move. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to kill me! BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  Everybody stay calm... Bumstead steps into the light, shoves his gun in White's handcuffs him.  Bumstead searches White, finds the revolv takes this.  Also takes his wallet.  He glances at the do who hides the syringe behind his back. BUMSTEAD (to Doctor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Schreber? Schreber nods blankly. Bumstead runs his hand over White's side pocket  -  feels something. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? White says nothing.  The inspector opens the pocket and l in. BUMSTEAD (disgusted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fish, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old-fashioned BLACK SEDAN drives over a rusty suspensi bridge.  Stone gargoyles look down at the lone vehicle. been raining.  Streets are empty.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: WHITE and the INSPECTOR drive silently.  Bumstead has app his un-marked police vehicle with all the comforts of hom Hot thermos.  Note pad holder, complete with light.  Coat hanger.  Gun rack.  A system for everything. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit! (glances at his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm curious?  How many so far? He shakes his watch, puts it to his ear. WHITE (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  I... BUMSTEAD (counts on fingers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see, there's the little guy with no arms or legs.  And the young boy? WHITE (disturbed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young boy? CLOSE ON WHITE  -  frightened now. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six year old.  Sure, you remember. Bumstead pulls something from under the dashboard.  A SAN carefully wrapped and prepared.  After glancing at his wa again, he bites into it. BUMSTEAD (chewing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, the kid you left in the meat packing plant, cut into pieces. Packed into brown paper parcels, wrapped in twine, that kind of thing. No answer. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure have demonstrated a great deal of...  imagination.  The baby was the best though.  Several cops lost their lunch over that one.  Head twisted off, spine pulled out, yeech... WHITE (cuts in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.  You're making me sick... BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We count seven so far.  Anyone we missed? RADIO CRACKLE O.S.  -  A tinny voice cuts in. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector Bumstead...  Inspector... Bumstead picks up a microphone, speaks into it. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Crenshaw? CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just reminding you...  your eight pee em... BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit. (looks at watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very efficient, as usual, Crenshaw. Remind me to give you my watch.  It needs fixing. CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Bumstead replaces the microphone under the dashboard, tak SHARP CORNER as he finishes off the sandwich. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going? BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up. Burastead pulls out a small brush, cleans the fallen crum his trousers, keeping a hand on the wheel. White is silent  -  his wounds continue to bother him.  H leans down to scratch through his trousers. WHITE (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gesundheit! WHITE (looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't sneeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INSPECTOR's car pulls up and stops.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing here? Bumstead grabs a bunch of flowers off the back seat. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD pushes the handcuffed WHITE through a swinging m door.  They enter a sterile air-conditioned room.  An effeminate MALE NURSE sits behind a glassed-in counter. Directly opposite is a small WAITING ROOM through a glass panelled door.  Bumstead pushes White into this room. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here. The inspector shuts the door behind him.  White looks abo blank room, takes a seat.  He can see Bumstead, through t glass panel in the door, walk up to the male nurse opposi

dialogues.speaker: OUT IN THE CORRIDOR
