dialogues.text: The inspector talks to the male nurse through a tiny open the window. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumstead.  I'm here to see my mother.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO WHITE
dialogues.text: He cannot hear anything of what Bumstead is saying.  He s him take out his wallet and show his badge.  The male nur concerned, looks over towards White, then opens a drawer, Bumstead a KEY.  The inspector steps back to the waiting door and LOCKS IT from the outside.  He looks at White fo moment, then walks away, along the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumstead enters darkness  -  pneumatic MACHINE NOISE fill gloom.  He walks quietly to his mother, encased in a meta contraption, something like an iron lung. BUMSTEAD (whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brought you these. He places flowers on the bedside table.  His mother just expressionless into space, in a coma.  He sits on a metal chair, looks at the woman.  Her life-sustaining machines and breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FINGER presses down on the sticky surface of a page.  I pulls away revealing an inky finger-print.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White is standing in a bare room, in front of a finger-pr machine.  He's alone.  A blast of electrical FEED-BACK. looks up at a speaker mounted to the wall. MECHANICAL VOICE  (through speaker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move  -  forward. White follows a painted line on the floor, stands against wall, in front of an old-fashioned camera.  A slot opens wall behind him, mechanical arms spring forward, restrain one arm holds a sign with a number in front of him.  A fl goes off, the click of a shutter. MECHANICAL VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left  -  profile. A claw lowers from the ceiling, grips White's head, turns abruptly  -  the camera fires. MECHANICAL VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right  -  profile. The claw turns his head the other way.  The camera fires MECHANICAL VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move  -  forward. Across the room A BUZZER SOUNDS, a red light flashes abov door.  White is released by the mechanical hands, walks o opens the door and steps into darkness. LIGHTS COME ON  -  extremely bright.  A room for line-ups markings on the white wall behind White indicate varying heights, a darkened window faces him.  He is obviously to identified by an unseen person. A buzzer sounds again, a light indicates another door. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move  -  forward. White moves into another room.  A chair faces a large whe painted in a black and white spiral.  He sits down  -  th wheel turns, faster and faster. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch  -  the  - wheel. The wheel stops after several seconds. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move  -  forward. The next room is full of scientific equipment. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand  -  behind  -  the  -  screen. White sees a metal-frame X-ray machine  -  he steps acros it.  The screen lights up, filling the room with a green We can see the shape of his skeleton.  Where his pocket w be, is the tiny skeleton of the fish. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move  -  forward. The next room is empty. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face  -  the  - wall. White turns.  As soon as he has done this hears a door op behind him.  FOOTSTEPS approach.  Blows rain down on him, boots, clubs.  He slides to the floor.  The lights go out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTS come on again.  White is dazed  -  in a chair, a b light in his face blinds him. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name? WHITE  (squints into light)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no? White shakes his head slowly and looks at the floor.  The is angled away, pointed down towards A TABLE.  White can now. HIS P.O.V. A featureless room.  STROMBOLI stands over him, behind hi BUMSTEAD and two shadowy guards.  Bumstead picks up an envelope, removes a SERIES OF PHOTOS, hands these to Stro STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John... He throws the first shot down on the table in front of Wh A black and white police photo of a murder victim. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Murderer. Another photo goes down.  Another victim.  Another and an Each more grisly than the last. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll sign a confession? White nods.  He's looks utterly lost. Bumstead steps across to a small speaker box on the wall the only door, presses a button. BUMSTEAD (into speaker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. TWO GUARDS immediately step through the door, GRAB White arms.  They carry him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White is woken by a UNIFORMED GUARD shining a light in hi eyes. GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White is led into an empty pale green room with a glass b down the middle.  The guard tells him to sit and wait. The door on the other side of the barrier opens with a sq DOCTOR SCHREBER steps in, looking frightened. WHITE  (to guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep him away:  He's insane. The guard just smiles, looks at the doctor knowingly. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, stay calm. WHITE  (to guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man wants to kill me. The guard remains indifferent. SCHREBER  (to guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one of his many delusions  - it's nothing. (a whisper to White)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  Listen, damn you!  This is a fortunate coincidence  -  we won't get another chance like this.  Listen to me. WHITE  (turns to Doctor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're innocent... (still a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't kill anyone. WHITE  (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I doing in here then? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to what I have to say.  Decide for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: AN ADJOINING ROOM
dialogues.text: The dark silhouettes of BUMSTEAD and ANOTHER COP watch fr behind a two-way mirror. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing here? COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says he is the man's doctor... (taps side of his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's his doctor... (into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the file on.. (reads clip-board)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel Paul Schreber M.D. MISS CRENSHAW'S VOICE O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schreber.  Yes.  Isn't that his doctor? BUMSTEAD (evenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's SCHREBER  -  with an 'h'. MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  An "h". The inspector looks up from the speaker. HIS P.O.V.  -  THROUGH THE MIRROR, White seems to have ca down.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE VISITING ROOM
dialogues.text: SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men in black  -  they're the killers. White stands abruptly, pushes himself against the glass. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a liar! SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's the truth. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're telling me the truth this time?  Is that it! The doctor removes a SMALL SYRINGE from his black bag, pl it on the table in front of the glass, blocks it from the guard's view. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you would only take this, inject it in your brain, everything would be much clearer. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that again... SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone get's one  -  very much like this... (points to syringe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this one's special.  It will help you understand, everything... WHITE (cuts in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not injecting anything into my brain. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton  -  I mean, John, there has been an experiment, a dangerous experiment.  I arranged it.  It was a lie from the beginning.  It almost worked, but things did not go as they should have.  You have been left  - blank. Schreber waves frantically at the air surrounding him. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can change this, all this. (points at syringe again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you must take it. White stares blankly at him for a moment, then: WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been working too hard. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please!  Don't be foolish!  Time is short.  Let me show you something. Look at this syringe. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask stupid questions.  Look at it. White reluctantly does this. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concentrate.  Imagine the syringe rising.  Picture it floating above the table.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON WHITE
dialogues.text: SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it! WHITE'S P.O.V. The syringe starts to vibrate, actually RISES INTO THE AI floats stationary between White and Schreber. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trick. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it isn't.  You are doing it!  Now raise it over the glass and... Suddenly the syringe spins towards the doctor, IMPALES it in his shoulder.  He yelps, grabs it. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry... The doctor pulls out the syringe, is about to say more wh BUZZER SOUNDS. MECHANICAL VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your  -  time  -  is  -  up. Schreber looks to where the voice came from  -  a speaker their heads. SCHREBER (looks at White)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave you your chance, now it's too late.  They'll learn you are here soon.  It's all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR SCHREBER paces towards the exit.  BUMSTEAD steps i front of him.  The doctor is startled. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor!  What brings you here? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just visiting my patient. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  And how is his state of mind? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's seriously disturbed... The doctor is nervous, glancing about. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem a little edgy.  Everything okay? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.  Everything's fine... He tries to push past.  Bumstead grabs his arm. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To tell you the truth, I'm glad we've run into each other like this.  Maybe you can help me tidy some loose ends. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loose ends? SCHREBER looks like a trapped animal, when: VOICE O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumstead! Bumasead turns to look down the corridor.  He sees STROMB peaking out of his office door. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to speak to you.  Immediately. The door shuts again.  Bumstead turns back.  The doctor i -  the corridor empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White is staring through a glass door at A COP.  A KETTLE WHISTLES O.S.  The cop gets up and moves off. White looks up. HIS P.O.V. A small WINDOW, high up on the wall.  Impossible to get t even if his hands weren't cuffed.  Nothing he can do  - looks at a clock on a wall. PUSH IN on the clock  -  TICKING GETS LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD enters STROMBOLI'S office.  A nervous CHIEF-INSP is flanked by TWO STRANGE-LOOKING MEN in ill-fitting brow suits. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumstead, these...  er, gentlemen are here to collect White. Bumstead suspiciously eyes the two men, beside STROMBOLI' desk. BUMSTEAD  (to men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? STROMBOLI (even more nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Bumstead.  Co-operate  - it's easier. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is highly irregular.  I have a right to know. MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are from a mental asylum. He notices that this man's moustache is LOP-SIDED.  The o man wears spectacles WITH NO LENSES in the frames, clutch un-lit pipe in his teeth. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  That's right.  He's ill  -  he needs expert help. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see... MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Inspector.  Has he been displaying any strange...  behaviour? BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been a little angel... STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could show them to the holding cell now. SLOW MOVE IN on Bumstead's face.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Bumstead and the MYSTERY MEN walk towards the holding cel Bumstead glances up through the glass in the door before enters.  IT'S EMPTY. He fumbles furiously for the key in his pocket  -  BURSTS the room.  White is gone.  But where?  Bumstead throws a back TO THE FRONT DESK. MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? The cop is just returning, holding a cup of coffee.  He l at the inspector, sees the room is empty.  A nervous twit knocks the cup from the cop's hands. TIGHT ON THE CUP  -  smashing on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underground.  CONSTANT NOISE O.S. of trains arriving and departing but none are seen. CAMERA MOVES PAST broken tiles on a wall to REVEAL:  WHIT sitting amidst rubbish on the ground, looking around, con groggy from sleep.  He looks down at his hands, unsuccess tries to free them from the cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: MOVE IN TIGHT ON WHITE
dialogues.text: He starts to cry.  He puts his head in his hands, his bod spasms with each sob. SEVERAL ANGLES of the empty corridors of the subway.  Whi crying is heard  -  echoic. BACK ON WHITE  -  A small feminine HAND touches his head. Startled, he throws himself back, like he's about to be attacked. THE BEAUTIFUL JAPANESE WOMAN from the church looks down a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD and the COP are getting grilled by STROMBOLI. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  I'm sorry...  But I don't understand how it was possible.  The only window was twenty feet up a vertical wall, he was cuffed... STROMBOLI (shouts at cringing COP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you have been so stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, get out. Bumstead gets up and leaves. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay. The cop hustles out, shuts the door. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumstead, you're starting to annoy me.  This case is very important to me.  Just a little warning:  I've got my eye on you inspector, remember that. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White, awkwardly trying to hide his cuffed hands in his c follows the JAPANESE WOMAN up a flight of dark stairs.  s keeps looking back at him, smiling but SAYS NOTHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White and the woman step into a run-down apartment.  She to a couch.  White looks uncomfortable.  She smiles again turns on the radio.  MUSIC. She steps into an adjoining bedroom, leaving White alone. gets up and starts to tune the radio.  A babble of fragme voices and music, then:  A NEWS REPORT... NEWS READER O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...earlier this evening it was reported a man fitting his description had been apprehended. White listens nervously. NEWS READER O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and now for a message from LUMP-O food products... Across the room he can see the woman's bedroom door ajar. crosses to the doorway and looks in.  The woman stands na against a deep red wall, her back turned.  She has an ela TATTOO on her back  -  looks like an INSECT.  She puts on dressing gown and TURNS SUDDENLY. White steps back before she notices him, he goes back to couch. She steps from the doorway holding a BAR OF SOAP in her h She sits down beside White and takes his hands, gently lathering soap around the handcuffs, continuing to smile him.  White looks down. His hands seem to have SHRUNK  -  they poke out of his sl like tiny children's limbs.  The cuffs effortlessly slip White looks at the woman, then back at his hands  -  NOTH STRANGE, they are normal size, but somehow the cuffs have removed.  He looks at the woman again, grateful.  He can' smiling. HIS P.O.V. Her eyes.  Her lips.  Her neck.  She leans forward, goes FOCUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches her tongue to his lips.  Kisses his face.  Sh pushes him back on the couch and pulls her dressing gown White does not respond  -  seems uncertain.  She sits upr astride his body, unbuckles his belt, opens his shirt, ca his chest.  She stops, her face in shadow. Slowly, White lifts his hands to her breasts, touches the She starts to breath deeply. OUT OF FOCUS  -  their bodies entangle, begin to move rhythmically.  The CAMERA TRACKS SIDEWAYS, REVEALS a micr behind a chair, leads us to a mirror on a wall.  On the o side of the one-way glass a reel-to-reel tape recorder is picking up the SOUNDS OF HEAVY BREATHING.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: The building the lovers are in SLOWLY RISES into the air, taller buildings and floats out over the city.  Its shado moves past empty plazas and across faces of grey towers.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: White sleeps, as buildings move past outside the window. opens his eyes, FORCES himself awake.  Looks across the d room. The JAPANESE WOMAN stands naked at the window, clutching large red megaphone.  IN PERFECT ENGLISH she shouts down streets drifting past. JAPANESE WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's up here!  He raped me!  Hurry! Before he kills again!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: MYSTERY MEN stand on roof-tops, watching the building dri past.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE ROOM
dialogues.text: White runs to the window, GRABS the woman.  As they strug the building is landing softly in another part of the cit LONG SHADOWS move towards the entrance... WHITE WAKES UP AGAIN  -  finds he is still on the couch. SIGN of the woman.  Then he notices her standing by the w (minus megaphone).  The wind pulls at her black hair.  A distant SIREN O.S. He gets up, walks over, stands beside her, looks out at t dark city.  She ignores him, goes back to the couch, turn table-lamp, puts her hands before the lit bulb, casts ani shadows on the wall. White watches her.  He walks across and sits next to her. points to herself. WOMAN  (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sachiko. He nods slowly, looks at her.  She waits for him to respo with his name.  He shrugs, remains silent.  Then he puts hands in the light, makes his own animal shadow. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me.  I'm a shadow. She smiles at the shadows. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like a murderer to you? She just keeps smiling, not understanding.  Kisses him. H notices an old phone on a corner table, removes the note and rings the same number.  This time, after several ring call is answered. WOMAN'S VOICE O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?...  Who is this?...  Who's there?... White remains silent.  Sachiko stands and leaves the room WOMAN'S VOICE O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John?  Is that you? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?  What do you know about me? In the darkness of a doorway Sachiko hesitates momentaril She slides a hand into White's coat, removes the wallet. takes out some cash, puts the wallet back, then she MOVES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD pulls up in his car.  Across the street is DOCTO SCHREBER'S surgery. He is about to get out of the car, when the SURGERY DOOR and A FIGURE steps into the street.  Bumstead watches the shadowy man for a moment.  Then gets out and FOLLOWS, ass it is Schreber.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEYWAY
dialogues.text: Bumstead follows inconspicuously.  Without warning, the f stops and TURNS.  Bumstead backs into a doorway to hide. gets a glimpse of the gaunt features of a MYSTERY MAN in dim light of the alley. When Bumstead steps into the alley again there is no sign the Man  -  like he disappeared into thin air.  A SHADOW crosses the wall beside Bumstead.  He spins, looking arou behind him.  Then he looks up into the air. HIS P.O.V. The shadow of a LEVITATING FIGURE crosses the face of a building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUND OF A WOMAN SOBBING O.S.  A wet dog sits in a corner gnawing a bone.  A crackly voice recites a list of names small speaker-box mounted to a wall.  A TREMBLING FINGER presses a door buzzer. SACHIKO, opens the door and looks out. ANGLE ON  -  A STRANGE WOMAN in the dark corridor adjusti hair nervously.  She pushes past the Japanese woman, into room.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John. WHITE stands inside the room, looking at the woman, expressionless. The woman suddenly leaps forward, grabs h kisses him passionately. White tries to push her away, but she takes his hand, pul inside her dress, makes him touch her breasts.  He pushes harder, she trips on a chair, falls to the floor.  She st to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA MOVES past flaking bricks  -  to a window.  Be the glass WHITE and SACHIKO sit across from the WOMAN who attacked White.  She is talking, though nothing can be he drying her eyes with a handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: The strange woman looks at White intently between sobs. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please believe me.  It's me, John. Your WIFE.  I wouldn't lie to you. You told me I could come and see you -  now you want to just send me away again... White looks AT THE FLOOR. HIS P.O.V.  -  a crack in the floorboards  -  movement underneath. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it would make more sense. I'm getting the pieces, but when I put it together it feels like... Like you're telling me about somebody else's life... WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the truth...  I need you.  I know you're innocent. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know I'm innocent? WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you are.  You couldn't do those terrible things.  Come home with me  -  maybe things will make sense then... WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that.  It's dangerous. What about my parents?  Do you know where I can find them? WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're dead, John. He stands and walks to the window  -  looks out at the ci WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have an uncle.  You were very close. She fumbles in her handbag, pulls out a notebook, scribbl something on a piece of paper, hands it to White. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where he lives. I'm sure he would like to see you. WHITE (taking paper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. WIFE (looks at him for a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want me?   My body? Remember how my skin feels?  Touch it.  I... She notices Sachiko  -  becomes self-conscious.  Sachiko silently stands and leaves the room.  The wife puts her f her hands, overcome with tears. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name? WIFE  (looks up  -  still sobbing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth. White removes the torn fragment of the photograph he has wallet, holds the black and white eye up to her face  - matches. WHITE  (thoughtful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... In the darkness of a doorway Sachiko watches the couple. MOVES OFF. ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to help... WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  Here... He pulls the postcard from his wallet, holds it up so the can see it. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know this place? She looks at the card. ELIZABETH  (stops crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  Your home town  -  where you grew up... White stands abruptly, startling the woman.  He glares do her intensely. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I get there?  Tell me. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's easy.  You... She trails off into silence.  Her hand, about to point in certain direction, freezes in mid-air. ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...strange, I forgot. White sits back down quietly. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Very strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sachiko locks the door behind her and steps to the middle the room, lifts a small round rug off the tiled floor. Underneath is a TRAP-DOOR.  Opening it, she climbs down a hole.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: In the semi-darkness she moves to a WOODEN BOX.  She cran small metal handle on the box which makes the lid open. plays softly. She looks into the yawning black mouth of the box.  A WOR apparition threads its way out of the hole, wraps about h thigh.  She breaths deeply, shuts her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ANGLE TRACKING SHOT  -  feet walk along a tattered ru approach a door.  Bumstead's shoes, shiny as always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK ON THE DOOR startles a huddled man in a blanket, sitting before a small t.v. set.  This is THOMPSON  -  th detective with mental problems.  He's unshaven, haunted. Clutching a shotgun, he steps to the door, peeks through hole. HIS P.O.V. Bumstead, back turned, glancing at his watch. Thompson backs away, points his gun at the figure through door. THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away! BUMSTEAD O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up, Thompson.  It's me... Thompson puts his eye to the door again. THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumstead? THROUGH THE SPY-HOLE LENS the inspector turns, looks at u face DISTORTED, fish-like.  Thompson undoes four locks, o the door a crack, but leaves it chained. THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't let you in...  sorry. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the serial killer case, need to talk. THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that.  Anything else. Thompson wipes at the sweat on his forehead. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look so well...  C'mon, let me in Thompson. Thompson stares at Bumstead, then silently unchains the d and lets him through. THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't talk about that.  As long as you understand, that's all. The room is very dark.  Bumstead is assailed by a wave of putrid smells.  It's a mess  -  rotten food, overturned furniture, dirty clothes. THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up some garbage  -  make yourself at home. Thompson smiles weakly.  They sit down, face each other i gloom.  A RAT scuttles past Thompson.  With lightning ref he throws a shoe at it.  The rat runs under a table.  He back at Bumstead, smiles, slightly insane. THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've taken my mind, my memories... BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Who has? THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your idea of a joke?  I don't remember... (looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my advice, Bumstead.  Get off this case.  Now. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is going on? THOMPSON (looks more frightened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish I could tell you, Bumstead. Strange business.  I...

dialogues.speaker: AAAAAAAHHHHHHHH
dialogues.text: He screams horribly.  Stands, clutching his head.  Startl Bumstead falls backwards off his chair.  Thompson, still clutching his head, runs and starts POUNDING HIS FACE aga the wall. THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away!  Leave me alone! Thompson's head is CHANGING  -  bloating.  It rapidly elo into a pink fleshy tube. Thompson's head continues to grow -  his features are los beneath folds of skin.  His screaming is stifled.  Thomps falls to the floor.  His head HUGE NOW  -  larger than hi body.  Small tendrils sprout from the main appendage. Bumstead takes cover behind a sofa. Then, as violently as the head began to transform, it sto Bumstead peaks over the sofa at the huge throbbing purple growth sprouting from Thompson's collar.  At the top of t growth an orifice opens. An EXPLOSION of green bile spouts into the room  -  cover everything in sight... Then the head starts to shrink.  Thompson's features appe again. It returns to normal size.  Thompson groans, spraw the floor, clutching his head. Bumstead looks on in horror. THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's  -  it's disgusting, I know... Thompson's face is heavily bruised, covered in sweat.  Hi starts to bleed  -  he wipes it on his sleeve. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!  We have to get you to a doctor... THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...  No doctor... Bumstead stands unsteadily. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...  How long has this been happening? THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few days...  a few weeks  -  dunno, I can't remember. (stands slowly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse thing is, I never know if it will change back again...  Now, please leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE, ELIZABETH and SACHIKO sit around a small table, ea quietly. Without warning, Elizabeth starts to cry again.  White tr ignore her. Sachiko looks sadly at the wife, puts a hand shoulder, gives her a handkerchief.  The woman quietens d They resume eating but in no time Elizabeth again bursts tears.  White looks at her now. ELIZABETH  (through sobs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... Sachiko leans across and puts her arm around Elizabeth, h her to her feet.  Elizabeth hangs onto the woman as she i from the room.  White can hear the sobbing still, as the move through to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit on the edge of the bed  -  Sachiko holds Elizabe hand, smiles at her. ELIZABETH (calmer now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...  This is embarrassing  - my husband doesn't know who I am... With this, she starts to cry again. Sachiko leans forward and tenderly kisses Elizabeth's lip

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON TWO MYSTERY MEN speaking in whispers.  The Men continue talking as THE CAMERA RISES, through several lev concrete and machinery TO REVEAL:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OTHER MYSTERY MEN are rigging a wire to some kind of ante device.

dialogues.speaker: BACK DOWN IN THE DARK CHAMBER
dialogues.text: The group of MYSTERY MEN have gathered once again.  One addresses them all. MYSTERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line of junction between two edges! MEN  (unison)

dialogues.speaker: YES
dialogues.text: MYSTERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have located him.  Now is the time, yes. A switch is thrown.  Electricity sparks to life.  A hum i the air. MYSTERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the tuning commence! The congregation of MEN place ELECTRODES to their forehea a trance-like manner.  They chant, quietly at first, stea building in volume.  The MEN stand and MOVE RHYTHMICALLY some inner beat. The CAMERA MOVES ACROSS to a diagram pinned on a board. representation of a man's legs.  Trousers rolled up above knees, showing a number of bite-like wounds on the flesh. Labels point out various parts of the legs in medical fas -  the legends are an unknown language.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOF
dialogues.text: The antenna glows with a ghostly green light.  O.S. SCREA RISE UP FROM THE STREET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White downs a cup of black coffee, staring blankly out th window.  O.S. distant screams. He glances across to a wall, notices A FLY there  -  some about it looks WRONG. FLY'S P.O.V. A distorted electronic image of White's FACE looming up. At exactly that moment the FLY TAKES OFF, flies erratical down the hall, around a turn and disappears.  White follo

dialogues.speaker: HALL-WAY
dialogues.text: White moves quietly towards the bedroom door. HIS P.O.V. It is ajar, dark inside.  Movement.  The women are naked bed.  The JAPANESE WOMAN has her eyes shut, head back in ecstasy. The WIFE is bent over her, kissing her stomach. ANGLE ON WHITE  -  watching through the crack in the door women are oblivious. He moves away slowly, feeling strange.  His feet stop mak contact with the floor.  He grabs a table to steady himse The table-cloth comes away, things spill to the floor and smash. He's FLOATING. White desperately reaches out to grab something, holds th light-fixture in the ceiling.  It breaks off in a cloud o plaster.  Sparks briefly illuminate.  He falls heavily ON CEILING  -  now the floor.  The apartment is upside down. He stares up at furniture and objects.

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: White steps into the room, eerily illuminated by a glowin heater stuck to the floor.  Water is running  -  filling tub and overflowing, making a suspended puddle above Whit head. White takes off his clothes and climbs the wall, towards floor.  It's difficult, but he reaches the tap, turns it Pulls himself towards the tub. Gravity becomes NORMAL AGAIN as he sinks in the warm wate He's incredibly weak  -  floats limply in the bath.  Subm his face.  A distant throbbing O.S., like a huge machine somewhere in the building. He opens his eyes, still underwater, stares up at the cei HIS P.O.V. A blurry DARK FIGURE moves into his vision.  It stares do him. White rigid with fright, cannot focus on the figure throu thin veil of water.  The FIGURE reaches out.  A GLOVED HA grabs White about the throat, holds him forcefully.  Whit gulps for air, swallows water.  His eyes widen.  He tries stop the hand strangling him but can't. Suddenly the hand pulls away.  The BLURRY FIGURE stumbles and ERUPTS into bloody explosion.  The body splits apart, throwing internal organs through the room. White awakens in the bathtub.  He looks about the room. Silent.  He gets out of the water, starts to dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD'S car pulls up.  He gets out, stained here and t with bile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HIGH ANGLE on the slain bodies of the JAPANESE WOMAN an WHITE'S WIFE.  TWO COPS wander about the dark room, doing stuff.  Bumstead walks up to the cop in charge. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the same entry wounds.  It's definitely him. (indicates Sachiko's corpse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lives...  lived here.  A prostitute. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other one? COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.  Small world. (looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the photographer? COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one available. A third YOUNG COP steps up to the cop in charge, glancing the bile on Bumstead's suit. YOUNG COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't come out. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll interrogate them anyway. The cop leads Bumstead behind a WOODEN PARTITION.  A smal neatly arranged  -  a double bed, various possessions.  S obviously lives here.  The room is empty however. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the family of the victim  - apparently they were in the apartment when he committed... BUMSTEAD  (looks around empty room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes... He walks to THE BED, bends over and lifts the bed-spread. the shadows underneath, Bumstead can make out SEVERAL FAC man, an old woman, three or four children. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't speak English... BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will we interrogate them? COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir...  I don't know exactly. Under the bed, Bumstead can see a LITTLE GIRL.  He walks to her.  She puts a hand over her mouth, edges away. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright.  I won't hurt you. Without coming out from under the bed she hands the inspe crumpled paper.  He looks at it then glances over his sho HIS P.O.V. The wooden room divider.  The CAMERA MOVES IN steadily, i crack running along the length of the divider  -  we can the room on the other side, with the cops moving about. Bumstead looks back at the page he holds in his hands. HIS P.O.V. A child-like DRAWING.  Two men, stick figures, dressed in black, with impossibly big knifes, slash at two screaming women. Unmistakable  -  MYSTERY MEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR SCHREBER walks stiffly into the room and sits at t head of a boardroom table.  He's cold, pulls his coat up his neck.  The long table is lined on both sides with imm MYSTERY MEN. A DARK FIGURE walks into the room, steps up to the other the table.  This is the enigmatic MISTER BLACK  -  only e seen hidden in shadow. MISTER BLACK  (addressing Men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. (peers at Schreber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor. He sits, dark and mysterious. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have called this meeting for a purpose, yes? (turns to Schreber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is clear to you we are  - unhappy, yes? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.  I... MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tuning failed  -  when our agents arrived he was gone.  He knows things -  predicts things.  Explain to us, Doctor.  Why is the situation this way?  Yes? Schreber seems distinctly uncomfortable. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not certain I fully understand myself... MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No excuses, dearest Doctor!  Answers. Yes? MYSTERY MEN  (chant in unison)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answers!  Answers! MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said this would be containable! Nothing works this time.  Why is this so? MYSTERY MEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why!  Why! SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I  -  ah  -  I...  it's a little cold in here don't you think? MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must find him.  This is your responsibility. SCHREBER (thinking fast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumstead once again scratches his head in front of a map. little girl's drawing is pinned to his board.  His attent wanders.  He notices a FLY CRAWLING across the wall in fr his face.  He leans closer, studying it. The intercom crackles to life.  The insect flies off. MISS CRENSHAW  (through intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A call, sir. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't say.  Says he must talk to you. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it through... A light flashes.  Bumstead picks up. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Bumstead.  Who is this? He listens intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD enters.  He looks nervous.  His SECRETARY sits a desk in an adjoining office, filing her nails. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need everything on the Jonathan White case. MISS CRENSHAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  Everything? BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the important stuff.  Wrap it up for me. The inspector turns to face her, a little manic. She is s at him. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please  -  I'm in a hurry. MISS CRENSHAW (evenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD steps from the doorway and walks across to his c briskly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumstead moves down a long corridor full of people in tow and swimming outfits, waiting silently.  They sit lined b wall, staring into space. Bumstead walks into a larger tiled room, full of steam. walks beside a heated pool  -  naked people swim about we or sit on the edge washing themselves.  He steps up to A DRESSED MAN, sitting silently on a bench.  It is WHITE. A feint smile brushes across White's lips as he looks up inspector.  He looks away, like he's forgotten something. Stands, walks over to the pool, cups his hand, bends down scoops some water. Bumstead sees White has picked up the LITTLE SILVER FISH. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why give yourself up? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I  -  ah - couldn't think of anything else to do.  I thought maybe you know something... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a pretty good escape act at the station.  How did you do that? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I woke up in a subway.  I don't know how I got there. BUMSTEAD  (not convinced)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. (pauses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you scared of? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People...  after me. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who they are. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are they after you? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know that either. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know much, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metal scraping. PIANO ACCORDION MUSIC wafts on a breeze, someone breathin HIGH ANGLE  -  Down through an OPENING metal hatch.  A di laboratory IS REVEALED  -  a maze of scientific instrumen Elongated shadows move about. MYSTERY MEN are hunched over something.  Behind them a diagrammatic chart of the evolution of the human brain. MAN 1 bends across to a CONTROL PANEL, works a switch.  A speaker in a metal box crackles to life.  SOUND OF DISTAN

dialogues.speaker: SURF. A WOMAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your name...  What is your name... Wires lead from the metal box to a HUMAN BRAIN within a metallic container.  Electricity arches across electrodes More sounds from the speaker:  WATER BUBBLING.  HIGH HEEL DOWN STAIRS.  BED-SPRINGS.  LOVERS MOAN PASSIONATELY. MAN 2 steps forward and pulls a bloodied sheet from their handiwork. A PUPPET-LIKE CREATURE is revealed.  Small  -  two and ha feet tall.  The top of its head an open hatch containing BRAIN.  Wires lead to this. TIGHT ON PUPPET'S EYES  -  They glance about the room. It is a series of geometric shapes and polished surfaces. MAN 1 shines a torch into the puppet's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE ITS HEAD
dialogues.text: Gears turn, illuminated by the beam of the light.  The ge part slowly to reveal a small writhing INSECT screwed to metal plate. MAN 2 shows the puppet PHOTOGRAPHS:  WHITE as he looks currently, shots of him as a teenager, a young boy, a bab Photos of what we realise are his parents, standing on a seaside pier sirtiling and waving.  Where he went to scho red push-bike he owned as a boy.  His first sweetheart. photo of a young woman smiling  -  his WIFE. MAN 3 holds up a small sea shell to the mechanical ear of puppet creature  -  MORE SOUNDS OF SURF... A FIGURE clutching a wooden cane looks on from the shadow His pale hand fondles the ornate handle of his cane  -  a carved silver insect.  It's MISTER BLACK.  Man 3 steps up him. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have duplicated the personality, yes. MAN 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is ready.  The Doctor was most helpful. Mister Black turns towards the OTHER MEN. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear a clock in my head, and I like it! MEN  (respond in unison)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear clocks in our heads, and we like it! MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A world in our likeness! MEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A world in our likeness! The Men close the hatch in the top of the puppet's head. SQUEAK...  CLUNK!  The puppet tests out its MANY WEAPONS, series of nasty-looking blades snap out of its small body retract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumstead leads White through the front door, into a SITTI ROOM.  Everything is extremely neat and organized, plasti coverings on all the furniture.  White steps towards a so BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  Not that way.  If you could just follow the covering  -  the carpet gets stained and it's impossible to clean. White stops. Bumstead indicates a CLEAR PLASTIC MAT runni through the room. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything the department knows about John White is in this.  Here. (hands file)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me for a moment. White flips through it.  Details of White's history.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Bumstead removes an empty suitcase from a closet.  Begins place neatly folded clothes within it. BUMSTEAD (calling to White)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Age thirty one.  Brown hair.  Green eyes.  Five feet, ten and a half inches tall.  Until recently worked for a firm manufacturing scientific equipment.  Wife's name  -  Elizabeth. Father and mother  -  Harold and Edith.  Both dead.  A history of mental instability...  etcetera, etcetera. Bumstead walks back into the sitting room, packed bag in He looks at White leafing through the file. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stuff helpful? WHITE  (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose... (looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you helping me? BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're case has been driving me crazy.  You see, I pride myself on being thorough.  There's too many loose ends with your case. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought it was best you were hidden until we understand more about the facts.  What do you know about these men in black? White looks up, pauses as if he didn't understand Bumstea then: WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you shoot them here... (points at his forehead)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you can kill them.  They're not people  -  like us  -  got insects in their heads...  Got any disinfectant? The inspector is caught off-guard by the question. WHITE  (continues)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my legs.  Been bitten.  Giving me trouble. Bumstead walks silently to the bathroom, opens a medicine cabinet. BUMSTEAD  (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insects? He returns clutching a small bottle and some cotton wool. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. (hands things to White)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful with your trousers.  That stuff stains. The inspector gives white back his revolver and his walle BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Bumstead paces thoughtfully, careful to stay on the plast protective covering.  He turns, glares at White, who dabs legs with the cotton wool. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea what part the Doctor plays in this business? White shakes head. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try and find out, shall we. (points at White's shoe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lace is untied. White looks down.  Bumstead doesn't lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARBER is shaving under the armpit of a client.  GRAN snores in a corner, his feet buried under a pile of hair clippings.. The BELL hanging above the door rings.  The door swings o BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He with you shortly, sir... Several heads turn, THEN LOOK DOWN to see the PUPPET.  Th puppet wheels forward and stops. BARBER (not really looking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, sonny.  Cute outfit.  Mother get it for you? The puppet crosses the room threateningly.  TWO OTHER CLI look up startled from their newspapers and girly magazine ON THE PUPPET  -  it wheels up to the barber's leg and GR TROUSER with a mechanical claw.  The puppet holds out a P OF White. PUPPET (incoherent obscenities)

dialogues.speaker: SHHHHIIIITTTT
dialogues.text: BARBER (looks down, scared now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? He's grabbed and THROWN into a nearby chair.  The puppet onto the bench in front of him  -  he's frightened, so ar customers. Puppet wheels up and down on the bench in front of the customers  -  stopping to glance at individuals in a thre manner, holding out the photo of white. It leans forward, spinning its blades  -  HAIR FLIES.  Sc o.s. The PUPPET retracts its weapons  -  COVERED in blood.  It wheels forward, through the door and into the street. THE CAMERA PANS to reveal a scene of complete carnage.  B covers the walls.  FOUR BODIES slumped about the room.  E an outlandish hairstyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White looks at the inspector  -  street lights pass over features.  Bumstead stares at the road. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't tell you the entire reason I helped you.  It started with two little girls.  Twins.  Used to play with them when I was young.  Couldn't remember for the life of me what they looked like, then I understood why... He looks at the dashboard, brushes away a small piece of BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't have faces. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  Just seamless flesh across the front of their heads.  No mistake.  I just hadn't remembered it that way.  Up until then they had been normal little girls in my memory. (looks back at White)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not all.  Once I started examining them, all sorts of things about my life, had... inconsistencies.  It was like a game. I would think about a person or a place, or an event.  Then I would turn the lights off.  Sit down in a comfortable chair...  And study each detail of this subject. He glances at White, then back to the road. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything was liquid beneath a thin surface that had always seemed solid to me... Bumstead and White are quiet momentarily, then: BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything you haven't told me about this business?  Even the most insignificant thing? WHITE (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Nothing I can think of. Except... BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  The only thing I've been certain of, all this time, is that I need to get to the ocean.  The point is no one seems to know how to get there. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, that's ridiculous.  You just... He trails off.  Shakes his head slowly. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get to the bottom of this.  I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor is sitting at his desk, when the door bursts o suddenly.  White and Bumstead move into the room and grab doctor before he can protest. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met a friend of yours the other night, doctor.  Tall fellow.  No hair.  Rather pale skin... SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's surprising.  He was leaving your office at the time... SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are mistaken. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you hiding? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  I don't know anything! BUMSTEAD removes his revolver, sticks it in the doctor's SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, they'll kill me... BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time you introduced us to your little friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHREBER, BUMSTEAD AND WHITE sit in Bumstead's car in an alleyway. Schreber points to a SOLITARY METAL DOOR in a wall. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In there. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that? The threesome step from the car, keep close to a wall. Schreber alone steps up to the door, leans down to a mat foot of the door, lifts it and takes a KEY from underneat unlocks the door, opens it, puts the key back, goes insid waves the other men forward. White and Bumstead step up to the door  -  Bumstead looks mat  -  it says:  WELCOME on it.

dialogues.speaker: A CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Through the door  -  AN ELEVATOR.  There is only a down b Schreber presses it, several seconds later the doors open They step inside.  The doors close, the lift descends. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this place? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't believe me if I told you, Inspector.  Have patience  - you'll see for yourself. When the doors open again the three men look out on a DAR PASSAGEWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PUPPET wheels up to the sweeping set of stairs at the of the building.  It stops, WHEELS BUMP into the steps repeatedly.  It looks down and shrieks with a string of mechanical obscenities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE and BUMSTEAD follow SCHREBER down a corridor to wha appears to be an ancient crypt.  They enter a door  -  it something written on it in a strange language.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE IS A ROOM
dialogues.text: They stumble around in the darkness, Schreber finds a lig switch, suddenly White STOPS dead in his tracks  -  Bumst turns to him. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. White points to a wall featuring a line of brass hooks. these hooks hang MYSTERY MEN coats -  that's not all.  Ea carries A FACE. Bumstead and White step closer, look at the faces.  They be elaborate, very life-like MASKS. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put them on. White and the inspector look at each other, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: The door opens.  White, Bumstead and Schreber step out, w poorly fitting masks and coats  -  DISGUISED AS MYSTERY M

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER ALONG THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: The three men come across a small area with a raised plat between arches.  A number of OPEN CARTS roll past on trac the scene resembles some bizarre amusement-park ride.  Th are numbered on the side  -  all of them empty. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.  Hurry. White, Bumstead and Schreber hop aboard.  The cart takes into a DARK TUNNEL, deeper into the secret underworld of MYSTERY MEN.  They MOVE THROUGH a subterranean landscape unexplained contraptions and bones. WHITE (to Bumstead)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think this goes? BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure isn't the fun-fair. The cart finally comes to a stop in a cave.  Bumstead, Wh Schreber leap out and hide in a dark doorway, as a LONG L MYSTERY MEN walk past them. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me, and do exactly as I do. They join the end of the line, falling into step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MEN, with WHITE, BUMSTEAD and SCHREBER in tow, enter sit in a number of rows of wooden chairs.  White and the inspector do the same. MORE MYSTERY MEN appear in circular portals high up on th concrete walls.  ONE MAN faces the others at the front of room. MYSTERY MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven past eleven  -  the Night of the Eye. The seated Men start to CHANT. MEN

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT OF THE EYE
dialogues.text: A MAN in the front row stands. MAN 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Eye is too small for the head of the pin! MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! ANOTHER MAN stands.  Next to the first, who sits again. MAN 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it that floats on the water? The Eye! MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed! So it goes around the room, each Man takes his turn annou part of the strange ritual.  It will be White, Bumstead a Schreber's turn shortly.  White is worried, looks at the others. WHITE (whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do? SCHREBER (hisses back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fake it! BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SCHREBER is next  -  he stands abruptly. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eye.  Master of time and space! Then it's Bumstead's turn. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Eye  -  um  -  delicious with horseradish on rye! MAN 1 at the front seems confused for a moment  -  SEVERA the others turn towards Bumstead. MAN 1 (uncertain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. The inspector sits back down  -  whispers to White withou looking at him. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to it... White stands.  Hesitates.  Then: WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eye...  eye, captain! White sits down, shaking his head, embarrassed. MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um  -  yes... THE MAN NEXT TO WHITE rises up  -  keeps rising, FLOATS I AIR above the Men's heads. MAN 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My spine will bend for the Eye! He turns sideways, still floating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK ABOVE GROUND, Bumstead, White and Schreber run from door at the end of the alley-way, tossing their masks awa BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that for real down there? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so. The inspector stops walking suddenly, grabs White, holds back. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that? At the end of the alley the PUPPET advances menacingly. Schreber takes his chance and runs down an alley and disappears. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick.  My car. Fortunately BUMSTEAD'S CAR stands nearby.  The two men le start it up.  Bumstead guns towards the puppet standing i glare of the headlights. The puppet's head opens, a TINY PROPELLER pops out, spins lifting the puppet into the air.  The car passes beneath speed.  Screeches off into a street, races along between buildings.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now? BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ocean business...  I know where I can find a map.  I need to go back to the station.  Where will you be? White thinks for a moment, pulls the paper his wife gave from his pocket. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go see an uncle of mine. (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five  -  one  -  eight  -  three  -  double six  -  three... Bumstead scribbles on the pad mounted to the dash, battle the wheel, driving at breakneck speed. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (looks in rear mirror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh... White turns and looks behind them. HIS P.O.V.  -  HEADLIGHTS gaining on them. ON THE PUPPET  -  sitting AT THE WHEEL of a stolen car, d like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN BUMSTEAD'S CAR
dialogues.text: White takes out his gun  -  AIMS at the rapidly approachi car. WHITE  (remembers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's empty. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take mine. Bumstead pulls a gun out of his coat.  They swap. The puppet PULLS ALONGSIDE, a mechanical arm extends towa Bumstead's front tire.  A SPINNING BLADE extends from the of the mechanical arm. PUPPET

dialogues.speaker: HA
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON THE BLADE heading for the spinning wheel.  White fires.  Shells hit the PUPPET'S car, shattering windows. THE BLADE cuts into the tire  -  it pops loudly, goes fla metal SPARKS off the road. White is thrown forward, hits his head on the dash.  Bums fights to keep control, SWERVES into the side of the othe vehicle, making it scrape a concrete wall, hits garbage c flying. The PUPPET'S car falls behind  -  then swerves off into a street and disappears. BUMSTEAD  (looks behind him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did it go? WHITE  (looks back also)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. Both look FORWARD AGAIN  -  to see the PUPPET'S CAR pull front of them, BLOCKING THE WAY.  Bumstead's car is going fast.  Slams the brakes. TIGHT ON PUPPET  -  Screaming with insane joy as Bumstead approaches like a bullet.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE INSPECTOR'S CAR
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jump! Bumstead rips the phone number from the pad.  The two men The car continues onwards.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: In the glow of the flaming wrecks, the two men pick thems up from different sides of the street.  Look at each othe turn and head in OPPOSITE directions. CAMERA MOVES IN on mangled metal  -  a MECHANICAL CLAW st to pull itself from the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White steps up to a SMALL DOOR in the side of a building. sign above the door depicts an underwater scene, crammed fish, sea-weed, bubbles floating to the surface.  Dominat everything is a GREEN MAN with scales  -  a KING NEPTUNE-

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: White stops in front of a ticket booth, beside a faded bl curtain.  In the booth a TICKET SELLER is snoring with hi hanging open, his head sagging. White knocks on the windo man wakes with a start. TICKET SELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  That's what I said! (looks at White  - rubs head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What..? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for this address. The man squints at the card White holds up, nods groggily TICKET SELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs.  Through there. He thumbs the blue curtain.  Curls up, shuts his eyes aga

dialogues.speaker: BEYOND THE CURTAIN
dialogues.text: A dark room full of BUBBLING NOISES AND WATER DRIPPING  - aquarium. Several corridors meander between large glass panels that into illuminated tanks of sea creatures. White moves past a shadowy doorway.  He can barely make o STAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White moves cautiously in the darkness.  On a door a tiny NAMEPLATE says:  K. WHITE.  The door is unlocked.  He ope and goes in.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: An entrance hall of an apartment.  A large number of MOUN FISH of all sizes line the hall. PHOTOS on the wall  -  family portraits.  White examines concentrates on one in particular  -  a young boy on a re bike, in the background a sign with a faded image of a gi a bathing suit:  WELCOME TO BLUMBVILLE!  it says. A strange WHIRRING NOISE O.S.  White hides behind a sofa. Whatever is making the whirring noise moves past slowly. cannot see what it is. VOICE O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John? White turns to see an OLD MAN in his pyjamas sitting in a WHEELCHAIR.  The man pushes a lever on the side of the ch whir of electric motors.  The chair carries him out of th shadows.  White steps from behind the sofa. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?  What are you doing here?  Is this one of your jokes, John?  It's been so long, I thought you'd forgotten your uncle Karl? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle...  Karl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A P.O.V.  -  MOVING THROUGH a dark, claustrophobic pipe. TWISTING around tight corners, DARTING down straight leng ducting.  Dim light spills from wire grills spaced along walls. WE TRAVEL up to one grill, at the end of a long stretch o tunnel  -  stop, nowhere left to go. We can see through t in the wire, looking down into...

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOM
dialogues.text: White and uncle Karl are having a SLIDE-SHOW.  Shots of a vacation  -  the uncle doing a series of mundane things. KARL (chuckling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not often I get a chance to show these. He changes the slide:  an image of him standing against a wall. KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is me again about  -  um  -  I would guess about twelve feet further to the right of the last shot.  Now just behind the wall is the hotel I stayed at  -  sweet little place... The PHONE RINGS.  Uncle Karl wheels over, picks up the re KARL (talks down the line)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...  Yes, he's here... (holds out the phone to White)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for you. White concerned  -  takes the phone. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? (he listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's you...  Yes...  My uncle apparently...  Just looking at some memories...  You have?  That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumstead talks to White on the phone.  He stands in a dar room, surrounded by charts and maps. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first I thought there was no way to get to the ocean...  The buildings are a barrier, no windows, no doors -  everything just, well, ends  -  only thing would be drill a hole.  But then, I saw it, one door, just one... Inside a tenement building... Bumstead is interrupted by a NOISE O.S.  He looks to a fr partition  -  dark figures walk past on the other side. quickly sorts through SEVERAL MAPS, making as little nois he can. BUMSTEAD (whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can meet later  -  but first I have to do something.  Look I got to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White holds THE PHONE, listens to Bumstead on the other e WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where can we meet?...  Alright. Good... As White hangs up he notices A DOOR behind a big old croc cupboard.  The cupboard has been pushed up against the wa hiding the door.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE POLICE STATION
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD quickly folds the map and shoves it into his poc As he turns and runs from the room we NOTICE A DARK FIGUR standing behind a shelf in the room.

dialogues.speaker: IN UNCLE KARL'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: UNCLE KARL continues to change slides  -  the noise echoi about the room.  White moves over and sits down next to h KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!  This is a good one! WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that door? KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.  Behind the cabinet.  Where does it go? The uncle watches the slides. KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a joker!  Like your father. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Have a look. He leads the old man over to the cabinet. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see it? KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does it lead? KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be a closet or something. White pushes at the cabinet.  The old man helps.  They on manage to push several inches  -  it is very heavy.  Whit decides to just climb over it.  He squeezes through, open door and climbs a set of dark stairs.  Uncle Karl watches KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't trip over.  It's dark up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON a light switch  -  it is flipped. AN ATTIC  -  full of books, boxes, discarded possessions. White picks up a book and opens it  -  the pages have bee eaten out by a swarm of ROACHES.  He drops it in disgust insects scurry over his hands. In a small wooden box are several toys he examines with g interest.  At the bottom of the box he finds a SMALL DOG- DRAWING BOOK.  On the cover is a colourful scrawl in chil writing  -  a title:  ANSWERS  -  BY JONATHAN WHITE, AGE White sits down and flips through the book in the dim lig Page after page is filled with neat handwriting and drawi As he reads segments from the book he seems more and more disturbed.  He flips through faster and faster. HIS P.O.V. Pages flip past, stopping occasionally.  Glimpses of DIAG The MYSTERY MEN and THEIR WORLD.  Cross-sections of the M MEN, the cavity in their head with the INSECTS INSIDE cle illustrated.  EVERYTHING. PUSH IN CLOSE on White.  He looks up, STUNNED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White emerges from the attic, clutching the small book to chest, lost in thought.  He steps quietly into a hall-way notices the old man putting THE PHONE back on its cradle. KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, I didn't see you there. A NOISE O.S. White and Uncle Karl turn.  A VENTILATION GR falls off a wall, revealing a hole.  EYES shine from the darkness. THE PUPPET leaps from the hole.  Its blades unfolding, spinning wildly before it hits the carpet.  It faces the men. KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that? WHITE (to Karl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back! KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filthy beast!  Shoo!  Go on!  Shoo! He wheels forward, attempting to scare the puppet off. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! The puppet goes for Uncle Karl.  A whirr of metal, BLOOD SPLASHES ACROSS WHITE and the walls.  Uncle Karl SCREAMS horribly. White grabs a chair  -  holds it above him.  The puppet t from the dead man in the wheelchair.  White lets it have The chair CRASHES DOWN, splintering into pieces. The puppet is dazed, but immediately recovers.  White has fire-poker now.  As the puppet advances, he swings, conne with the creature, hurtling it across the room, into a wa White runs out the door.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: He leaps into a waiting elevator.  Pushes the top floor b THE ELEVATOR SHAFT  -  The elevator moves upwards.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: White looks through the circular window in the door. HIS P.O.V.  -  Floor after floor SLIDES PAST  -  deserted looks at the floor indicator.  TIGHT ON NUMBERS lighting 86, 87, 88... Then the elevator stops, the doors open, looking down a d corridor.  The PUPPET is at the end.  It turns to face hi SUDDENLY RACES FORWARD, a horrible high-pitched shriek fr mechanical voice box. White STABS the buttons of the elevator frantically, the won't close.  The puppet is upon him.  He JUMPS, straight It goes under him, CRASHING INTO the back of the elevator White hits the down button one last time, and leaps out o compartment AS THE DOORS CLOSE. A MECHANICAL extendible arm shoots out and grabs White ar the ankle. DRAGS him across floor.  THE PUPPET shrieks wi again, as... ITS ARM  -  is JAMMED in the closing doors now.  Lift des The puppet squeals.  The arm SNAPS OFF. White stands, pulls dislocated arm off his ankle.  He can the elevator descending.  Suddenly it STOPS  -  starts returning to his floor.  White turns and runs again. The lift doors BURST OPEN  -  the ENRAGED CREATURE emerge races after him. He tears around a corner  -  finds himself in a dead-end. Nowhere to go.  He can hear the puppet approaching along corridor.  Suddenly he notice A GRILL on a wall ABOVE HIS He pulls it off, climbs into an incredibly tight pipe.  C frantically. He sees a LIGHT ahead.  An opening.  He kicks the grill o sudden gust of wind. HIS P.O.V. The pipe leads to the outside of the building  -  nowhere except a hundred stories STRAIGHT DOWN.  He screams, almo falls.  Turns to start crawling back. Suddenly the end of the pipe fills with WHIRRING METAL BL The puppet has followed him in and is advancing. No choice  -  he looks out the hole.  SEES A PIPE on the outside of the building, running vertically near the open It looks impossible but it's his only chance. He climbs out, balancing himself on the lip of the openin REACHES for the pipe.  The puppet is almost upon him.  He swings across, gets a HAND on the pipe.  He slips, DANGLE holding on  -  one hand on the pipe, one on the edge of t The pipe is greasy, slippery, can't grip it. SUDDENLY he hears a MECHANICAL CLICKING  -  TURNS to see puppet standing on the edge of the hole, inches from his A soft noise reverberates in its voice box  -  a mechanic giggle?  A circular blade on one of its arms starts up, m down onto White's HAND. TIGHT ON HIS EYES  -  sweat beads and runs down his foreh TIGHT ON THE BLADE  -  as it cuts into flesh.  BLOOD spat White's face as he grimaces with intense pain.  He can't on. HE FALLS, plummets through space.  Screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GROUP OF SURGEONS stand about BUMSTEAD'S MOTHER on her support machinery.  The surgeons have face-masks on and a deep shadow.  The woman stares blankly, still in a coma.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RECEPTION AREA
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD looks up from his wristwatch. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait any longer... He is standing in front of the MALE NURSE in the glassed- counter. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I told you, she is being examined... He turns and storms off down the corridor.  The NURSE sta shouting after him. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Bumstead!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE MOTHER'S ROOM
dialogues.text: One of the "doctors" leans down and grabs a handful of WI leading out of a box beside the woman. SURGEON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will teach the pig to meddle in our affairs.  Yes. He pulls the wires out in a burst of electrical sparks  - THE MACHINES DIE.  The woman comes to life momentarily, s to claw at the glass shield in front of her face, like sh suffocating.  The life drains from her weak body and she STILL. ANGLE ON THE DOOR  -  it bursts open.  Bumstead is standi there.  The masked surgeons are startled, they turn rapid face him. BUMSTEAD (steps forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is happening? SURGEON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Inspector Bumstead!  We are glad you are here  -  I'm afraid we have done all we can.  Yes.  Your Mother has passed.  Yes. Bumstead turns towards his mother. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she was getting better... SURGEON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are sorry.  The cancer  -  it was fatal. Bumstead turns to the men, confusion in his eyes. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't have cancer. The men glance at each other for a moment, then back at t inspector. SURGEON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We knew that.  Yes. (the other men nod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway  -  she is dead. Bumstead leaps forward, RIPS OFF one of the surgeon's mas ANGLE ON THE MAN  -  He turns to look at Bumstead, pale s staring eyes, a MYSTERY MAN.  TWO OTHER MEN grab him from behind. BUMSTEAD (struggles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill you all! One of the Mystery Men steps up to the struggling inspect places the palm of his hand across Bumstead's eyes. MYSTERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will obey us, yes.  In your mind there is a dark space...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumstead's hand reaches out, fumbles at a tray of surgica implements, grabs a SCALPEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cuts into the hand of one of the Men holding him, SPIN DRIVES the scalpel into the forehead of the Mystery Man attempting to hypnotise him. The other Men leap towards him.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON WHITE'S FACE
dialogues.text: His eyes are shut tight.  He opens them, slowly LOOKS ARO curious why he isn't dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White floats in MID-AIR, hovering ten feet or so above a body of water.  He looks amazed.  Shuts his eyes, rubs th opens them again.  Still floating. He clenches his fists and TENSES his body.  Slowly he sta MOVE FORWARD, hovering at an even height over the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL ANGLES feature the figure of White levitating acr the harbour, past half-sunken buildings and rusted ships. TIGHT ON WHITE  -  He comes to a stop.  Smiles in amazeme Then he suddenly plummets into the water, like a trap-doo opened beneath him. ANGLE ON BUBBLES floating to the surface.  White's FACE r slowly out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL OBJECT floats towards the ground at the end of a white parachute.
