dialogues.speaker: BACK ON WHITE
dialogues.text: He swims across to a small boat, climbs aboard, pushes hi silently through the still canals of the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oil tankers move silently through inky water. White paddles the boat to the bottom of A PIER, climbs a ladder.  He runs off into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: The PUPPET cuts through the waves, pushed along by a rear propeller.  It reaches the pier, climbs to the top.  The retracts, and the creature wheels forward slowly, onto a concrete surface.  It looks around  -  it knows White is somewhere. PUPPET'S P.O.V. A trail of WET FOOTPRINTS on the ground.  It follows them led to a crane cabin. INSIDE THE CRANE'S CABIN  -  is White, a lunatic grin on face, at the controls. A NOISE O.S. startles the puppet.  It looks up. PUPPET'S P.O.V. Follows the crane up into the air.  The crane is swinging against the dark sky.  A HUGE METAL CONTAINER dangles, st above the puppet.

dialogues.speaker: ON WHITE
dialogues.text: WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice knowing you. TIGHT ON WHITE'S HAND  -  It pulls a lever. THE CONTAINER  -  Shakes and starts to fall. THE PUPPET  -  Screams up at the plummeting container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The container crashes into the ground, crushing the creat Silence.  Dust floats in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD's running.  He looks a mess, clutching a bleedin in his side, cuts on his face, clothes torn  -  but he ma out alive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD sits on the ground, leans against a wall, breath heavily  -  he's losing a lot of blood. He waits. A NOISE O.S. startles him  -  A FIGURE in the shadows acr roof. BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White? It's too big to be White.  The man steps from the shadows STROMBOLI (walking forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Bumstead. He's holding a gun, levelled at the inspector.  Bumstead bleeding, against the wall.  He points his own gun at the advancing man and pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: CLICK
dialogues.text: BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit. Stromboli is upon him, grabs the empty gun, throws it awa picks up the inspector, leans him against the wall.  With Stromboli holding him up, Bumstead would not be able to s STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you always have to find things out the hard way!  Couldn't you just do your job, you idiot?  I told you, didn't I?  These people are not playing games, Bumstead.  They can do anything they want, don't you understand? BUMSTEAD (a hiss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one of them.  You bastard... STROMBOLI (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a way, we all are, inspector! You.  Me.  Everybody! Stromboli carries Bumstead towards the EDGE of the roof. keeps laughing. STROMBOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for that early retirement, Bumstead.  Didn't bring the gold watch I'm afraid. BUMSTEAD (weakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...  Please... INSPECTOR'S P.O.V. THE EDGE looms up  -  a long drop to the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White paces nervously through empty streets.  He stops, t his bearings, then turns and runs into: A SILHOUETTED FIGURE in a bizarre metal contraption on wh A skeletal hand reaches out to White, grabs his arm.  An moan. Terrorised, White pulls back. FIGURE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh...  it hurts!... The mechanized figure trundles forward, pins him to a wal streetlight reveals... DOCTOR SCHREBER covered in blood, encased in a metal fram covered in silver blades. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm...  being...  punished. The blades are connected to the wheels  -  they turn when moves forward, metal cuts into his flesh, slowly SKINNING ALIVE.  A torture machine.  Between screams of intense pa doctor speaks. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to  -  ahhhh  -  find you...  I.. I... The doctor shuts his eyes, a trickle of blood runs down h face. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are...  living in their dreams... Schreber turns and rolls off into the night, screaming  - SPIN furiously, peeling back flesh.  He glances at White last time. SCHREBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insect...  dreams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE is running.  As he approaches the building he hears scream  -  looks up to see a figure PLUNGE OFF the roof. He runs over.  Looks down at the twisted body.  THE INSPE moans  -  barely alive.  White kneels by his side. BUMSTEAD'S hand moves across to an expanding POOL of red him, traces an 'H' on the ground in the blood. WHITE (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aitch? The inspector seems to be dying, then revives momentarily A MAP in white's hand, looks up at him: BUMSTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gesundheit! His eyes roll up and he GOES LIMP.  White stares at the b then: WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't sneeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MORTICIAN turns off the lights in the main hall and s into his office, sits down, pours himself a hot drink; tu the radio, opens his conic-book. A NOISE O.S. disturbs him and he gets up, walks out of hi office, looks into the darkness. HIS P.O.V. PANS around the empty morgue.  Nothing.  Decid back to his office.  He turns and is startled by three MY MEN obstructing his path. MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking for the White victims. MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who the hell are you? The mortician catches a glimpse of the shiny dagger Man 1 clutching by his side.  He becomes very scared. MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there.  Numbers eight to twelve. THREE MEN look over to where the mortician has pointed in unison.  Man 1 looks back. MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. A FLASH OF STEEL.  The mortician's throat SPOUTS blood. reflexively at the gash and falls back onto the floor, DE before he hits the tiles. The Mystery Men step to an adjoining chamber.  Man 2 puts Box he is carrying, opens the lid.  A green glow oozes ou other Men manipulate levers on a control panel on a nearb wall.  Stainless steel doors open.  Body-length trays sli the dim light.  SHAPES covered in white sheets. Man 2 with the box removes a GLASS SYRINGE, filled with a glowing green liquid.  He steps TO THE BODIES and injects with the syringe, through the sheets.  When he has finish steps back, places the syringe back in the box.  The MEN silently. All is silent and still. Then the shape beneath a sheet starts to SIT UP.  Then an and another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE is running again, clutching BUMSTEAD'S MAP.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA PULLS BACK AND UP
dialogues.text: REVEALS the entire corridor.  KEEPS PULLING BACK  -  unti view is impossibly wide  -  like a cross-section of the b he's in, a doll's house with the roof taken off.  The TIN FIGURE runs, amidst a dark network of surrounding rooms a passages.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUE PULL BACK
dialogues.text: White is no more than a SPECK  -  the hall-way stretches ENDLESSLY in both directions, behind and in front of the figure, through an infinite labyrinth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We no longer make out the figure.  The x-rayed environmen resembles some intricate aerial map of the vast city  - corridor an ever increasing SPIRAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White reaches the top of a spiral flight of stairs. HIS P.O.V. APARTMENT 'H'  -  a rusted metal letter on the door.  Whi forward.  He knocks once and the door creaks open, unlock

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: The rooms are empty, derelict, strewn with rubbish.  Moul on the damp walls.  A door stands at the end of a long em room.  He can hear the muffled sounds of SURF, SEAGULLS. starts to walk forward, smiling.  As he approaches the do begins to feel colder. He opens the door and looks out.  A blast of SUNLIGHT  - ocean and sky. VOICE O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John White... White does not turn about, he takes a step forward, then another  - and RUNS INTO THE SKY  - A PAINTED WALL. He gl at a small SPEAKER built into the wall  -  the SOURCE of side SOUND EFFECTS. He hears the click of the gun being cocked behind him.  H dashed, he turns.  ANGLE ON A MYSTERY MAN  -  a gun point White's stomach. MYSTERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing, Mister White. Beyond the city.  Never has been. Unfortunate.  Yes? White is led into a pitch black room.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON WHITE'S FACE  -  In the darkness  -  he looks ac the Mystery Man standing beside him. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know where to find me? MYSTERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We knew you would turn up here eventually...  Been waiting for you, yes.  Hoped you wouldn't make a nuisance of yourself on the way... The Man motions with the gun for White to walk forward. as White turns to do this, the Man slips from the room an shuts the door, cutting off any existing light. A NOISE O.S.  -  some kind of machine being turned on  - start to come up all over the room. It's a normal, average-sized, living room.  All the furni has been removed and replaced with chairs, tables, podium arrangement resembling an IMPROVISED COURT of law.  In fa White realizes he is standing behind some kind of witness The apartment is devoid of people, though almost immediat door opens to the side (looks like it would lead to the kitchen) and a series of figures step through.  MYSTERY M All the MEN take up specific positions around the room, w uttering a word, but don't sit.  One MYSTERY MAN opens a beneath an arched entrance  -  beyond it, within a very s room, stand DOZENS OF PEOPLE, crammed shoulder to shoulde people stare at White silently  -  a bizarre gallery of spectators. An eerie silence falls on the room. The kitchen door opens again.  White is shocked to see th VICTIMS WALK INTO the room and adopt positions in what is obviously the area for the jury. The DISEMBOWELED CORPSE OF A WOMAN steps out of the shado pushing a pram.  Her throat is cut, she is shrouded in a sheet. Within the pram is the BABY clutching its own head, with attached, under its arm. Then the mutilated FREDRICK hops out, followed by the thr brown blood-stained paper parcels containing what is left the YOUNG BOY. Finally, his WIFE and the JAPANESE WOMAN, still in passio embrace, take their positions. Another door opens  -  a closet. Within stands the figure only seen as a shadow  -  the elderly MYSTERY MAN with th MISTER BLACK slowly reaches above him and pulls at a chai hanging from the ceiling  -  the light snaps on inside th closet.  Somewhere, a long way off in the same building, toilet is heard flushing. He is much older than the rest, carries himself with auth as he hobbles across the room to a raised podium, support his withered body on his cane.  Looks like he will play J Everyone in the room now sits.  Mister Black looks at Whi ANGLE ON WHITE  -  He starts to tremble, not so much from but cold. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome. White just looks at him, still clutching the small notebo called:  ANSWERS. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John White, you are to be tried for murder, yes.  You wish to confess to these crimes now? White is silent.  He leans over and scratches his legs th the fabric of his trousers.  They itch like crazy. Mister Black turns to the assembled people. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well.  The testimony of the prosecutors.  Yes. TWO MYSTERY MEN stand and step across to a wooden easel. stands beside it, reveals a series of visuals, charts, et drawn on stiff cardboard.  MAN 2 uses a pointer while he describes the evidence to support their case. MYSTERY MAN 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will show that John White is abnormal, a menace to society, a dangerous sick individual, and that the court should have no mercy in finding him guilty and punishable to the extreme for his crimes. MAN 1 places a large black and white photo blow-up on the easel.  It shows White at the door of the JAPANESE WOMAN' apartment, clutching a kitchen knife, covered in blood. MYSTERY MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhibit A shows the accused leaving the scene of his most recent crime, yes.  A photo taken by a remote camera planted by one of our agents. White watches in stunned silence. A general murmur of agreement through the room as the poi made.  Mister Black turns to the victims, nods his head s MYSTERY MAN 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhibit B... MAN 1 removes a small tape recorder, hands it to MAN 2. MYSTERY MAN 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actual tape recording of accused committing aforementioned crime, yes. He turns a switch, the reels spin slowly.  A hush fills t room. VOICE 1 (sounds like JAPANESE WOMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...  Please... A scream. VOICE 2 (sounds like White)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Another scream.  A ripping sound. VOICE 3 (sounds like his WIFE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John!  Don't... Another scream. White is standing up, involuntarily, he can't listen to t any longer. WHITE (a squeak, almost inaudible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!  This is a lie... Mister Black turns to White.  The Men testifying stop the and look at him also. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something to say?  Ready to confess? The Men in the audience turn and all stare at White, as d victims and the spectators in the adjoining room. WHITE (back to a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill anyone. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak up.  Yes. WHITE (finds his voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's lies.  Everything. He grips the barrier before him. A SHRIEK from the pram containing the BABY  -  it rocks v from side to side. The DISEMBOWELED WOMAN rises from her chair.  She has dif standing, her limbs stiff.  She looks at White, opens her to say something, but no sound comes out.  Instead a tiny CRAB scuttles out, across her face, and falls to the grou She sits down. White is stunned. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the witnesses. AN OLDER COUPLE are led out of the kitchen by a Mystery M Shown to seats behind a podium.  The woman looks sadly at MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the accused's parents? FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... MISTER SLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had your turn!  Let them speak. WHITE (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents are supposed to be dead! You can't keep changing the damn rules like this!  Why go through this ridiculous set-up!  Why don't you just kill me and be done with it! MISTER BLACK (smiles at parents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, continue... WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insane! He looks over to the victims. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was them, not me. (points at the Mystery Men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They killed you. Looks back at the Mystery Men. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have invented all this.  History is a lie, not just mine, everyone's  - a fiction.  You are the authors. His knuckles go white as he squeezes tighter on the barri MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fanciful idea, Mister White. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone has a job  -  a function.  Each one teaches you more about your invention.  I'm what is called a murderer. The whole court listens in silence to White's testimony. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've given everybody memories, but I missed out.  The Doctor saw to that -  played your own game.  And now... WHITE looks at the MYSTERY MEN, then back at MISTER BLACK WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying to get rid of me. There is silence.  Whispers.  Faces staring. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I threaten you?  You're scared aren't you? MISTER BLACK and the gathered MYSTERY MEN look speechless White.  Suddenly everyone bursts into spontaneous LAUGHTE by Mister Black. A terrible cackle fills the room  -  all the MYSTERY MEN hysterically, so do the mutilated victims.  The spectator the adjoining room remain silent. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah  -  a plot.  Now we have a plot! (chuckling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very inventive... The older couple behind the podium look disturbed. MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, John, you're embarrassing us... WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! MISTER BLACK (chuckling still)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have proof?  Evidence?  Yes? WHITE (holds up notebook)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all here! Mister Black seems startled by the book, then pretends it nothing. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A book of delusions.  Anything else? WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I... MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. (turns to the victims)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The verdict, yes... WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, this isn't fair... The DISEMBOWELED WOMAN stands again.  This time she opens mouth, there is a bubbling noise, water runs out, then: DISEMBOWELED WOMAN (whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guil  -  ty... White is agitated, fear in his face.  Mister Black stamps PAPERS before him repeatedly. ON THE PAPERS  -  official-looking documents.  The stamp GUILTY. CLOSE on White's eyes. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I pronounce sentence... Suddenly the papers on the bench in front of Mister Black INTO FLAMES.  Mister Black recoils, almost falling off hi chair, taken by surprise.  The Mystery Men all look at Wh murmur of concern. Mister Black looks up at White  -  angered. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you use your tricks on me! White, genuinely surprised, looks around.  Several Myster BACK AWAY from him, scared. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't realise... MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, freak!  Monster!  You are insignificant. He glares across the room, angrily.  An WOODEN CHAIR in a starts to vibrate. CLOSE on Mister Black's eyes. The chair rises into the air  -  HURLS across the room at Mister Black laughs as it crashes into the wall.  White d just in time. The gathered Mystery Men erupt into enthusiastic applause White regains his composure and tries some mind tricks of own.  He lifts a small table into the air, and makes it s a knife and fork dance back and forth on the surface, as plates (from a stack in the kitchen) hurl, firstly at the spinning table, then go flying across the room, smashing Mister Black, making him dance back and forth comically. This display is accompanied by a rousing rendition of a W playing on a floating gramophone White has also activated his mind. SEVERAL Mystery Men are TERRIFIED.  White is amazed at hi performance. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll regret that. Mister Black is furious, spluttering, spit flying from hi mouth. MISTER BLACK (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: SHUT IT DOWN
dialogues.text: A Mystery Man by the window, picks up a phone and dials furiously.  Everyone in the room remains silent  -  waiti MAN ON PHONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we have a problem here.  Shut it down immediately. White doesn't understand what is going on.  O.S. the SOUN machinery WINDING DOWN. ANGLE ON a clock hanging on the wall.  ON the SECOND HAND suddenly STOPS. All eyes are on Mister Black. MISTER BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has all gone too far.  Yes, much too far. Mister Black starts to SHAKE.  His eyes shut, clenches hi teeth, grips the insect on his cane, plants his feet firm the floor. Around the room WALLS CRACK, plaster rains down from the ceiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All over the city things START TO FALL APART  -  a devast impact on the landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A street CRACKS OPEN.  Beneath the pavement are pulsating intestine-like organs.  These burst open with pus... A building vanishes... A car on a street corner flies into the air... A telephone box STARTS TO SPIN, faster and taster, diggin itself into the concrete.  Monstrous INSECT LEGS sprout f hole left behind... Geysers of STEAMING BILE spurt into the night sky... BLACK EXCREMENT forces up out of a sewer, runs down stone steps... THE CITY is coming apart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room looks like an earthquake hit it  -  broken furni gaping holes torn in the walls. Several MYSTERY MEN huddle behind an upturned table, watc WHITE and MISTER BLACK.  They face each other, both still standing  - mental energies focused against each other in The fighting is taken its toll on both men. A DAGGER hangs suspended in mid-air, slowly rotating to f White with its shining silver blade. Mister Black is clenching his rotting teeth, tightening b fists by his side.  Pushing every ounce of mental power a knife. White, bleeding from a gash in his cheek, is straining hi against the knife. The blade STARTS TO MOVE, ever so slowly at first, toward White.  His body is shaking with his mental effort.  A be sweat runs down his brow, dripping into his eye, blurring vision. He is losing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see an OUT OF FOCUS IMAGE.  A group of dark figures. regains consciousness, strapped to a kitchen table.  From perspective, in the immediate foreground, a figure speaks removes a syringe from White's FOREHEAD. FIGURE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good as new.  Yes.  Everything is easier now. His vision CLEARS, he can see.  It's MISTER BLACK.  Behin SMALL CROWD who turn out to be MYSTERY MEN. Mister Black suddenly pulls at his own face, removes the Underneath is a mess of PULSATING ORGANS AND INSECT PARTS This is what Mystery Men really look like.  He laughs, st MOVE rhythmically  -  a strange dance-step.  The others j as they too pull off masks. Each Man reaches up to his left ear in unison.  They pull squirming INSECTS out, hold them up to the light.  The in scream triumphantly. White screams too.  And he can't stop. Everything goes BLACK.  Then the sound of a key rattling lock.  A door slowly creaks open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A P.O.V. enters a small room. Dappled SUNLIGHT through a tattered lace curtain. A clock on a wall.  A cough O.S. from the corridor.  A FAT MAN, t he enters: FAT MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's small but clean... (it isn't)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the view's nice. (points to window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it? JOHN WHITE enters.  He is haggard, eyes rimmed with red. still holds the small black NOTEBOOK, tight to his chest. stands in the centre of the room, looks up.  Strangely, t the room is very small, it extends upwards several storie windows sit at various heights. White walks to the lace curtain, opens it with shaking ha

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: A narrow street and at the end, the ocean.  The sound of surf, he can taste the salt spray. WHITE (without turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it. The man behind him blows his nose loudly and turns to go, shutting the door.  White puts the notebook down on a tab the open window.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: White has fallen asleep on the bed. He wakes, troubled.  Stands and walks over to the sink ne the bed.  He moves like he is underwater.  The sea-breeze the curtain, draws him to the window. HIS P.O.V. Down the street to the small patch of sand between buildi TWO FIGURES  approach each other. He pulls out his wallet and removes the torn photo of the woman, places it against the pillow on the bed.  He sits edge of the bed and lifts his trousers, looks at his legs nothing out of the ordinary. White is disturbed by a TINY MOVEMENT in his coat pocket. reaches in and pulls out a small, EMACIATED FISH. Disgusted, he drops the fish to the floor, looks at the creature.  White raise his foot.  His heel comes down wit sickening SQUISH. THE CAMERA MOVES IN STEADILY towards the notebook near th window.  As the SHOT TIGHTENS we can read the title on th cover:  ANSWERS  -  BY JONATHAN WHITE, AGE NINE. Now a sudden GUST OF WIND blows open the book.  The pages flicker past.  Glimpses of happy things.  A child's drawi smiling people.  The sun shining down on a blue ocean ful sailing boats.  Fields of colourful flowers.  Cute animal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUND OF SURF, distant, muffled. CAMERA MOVES slowly towards a door.  The final door  -  n others beyond this.  ECHOIC FOOTSTEPS. TIGHT ON WHITE  -  His haggard face moves through darknes looks down at his walking feet. HIS P.O.V.  -  White sees water, waves breaking, through cracks in the floorboards of the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cracks around the closed door are illuminated, white- by the SUN outside. ON HIS HAND  -  As he reaches towards the handle. ON HIS FACE  -  As the door opens.  A sharp line of light across his features, as his eyes blink and water.  The wi pulls at his messy hair.  SURF NOISE is louder now. REVERSE ANGLE  -  WIDER  -  OUTSIDE looking through the d along a long wooden pier jutting out into a blue seascape the end of the pier stands the tiny figure of A WOMAN WIT HAIR.  She looks out at the ocean, her back turned. ANGLE LOOKS BACK at White standing in the open doorway, s into the sun.  Suddenly he looks relieved, almost happy f first time.  He steps OUT OF FRAME briskly  -  a weight g from his shoulders.  Everything is clear finally, he know exactly what to do. A voice recites names over a P.A. system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRACKING SHOT follows White, moves down the pier toward woman.  As White steps up to her, she turns and smiles. WOMAN  (indicates the sea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful. White nods slowly.  He looks out of place in his crumpled He stares out at the ocean.  Seagulls fly over.  Sun refl off waves. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name? He looks at her.  Smiles.  Then, slowly, brings his hands throat. WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John...  White.
